Reviews.Title: “Tryp Barcelona Apolo”
Reviews.Author: Caryl2506
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased with the hotel. Our room was excellent and as we were travelling with our two granchildren we had a double room with the girls having their own space with sliding doors between the two rooms. The room was very clean and comfortable and quiet being at the back of the hotel. We had breakfast on two of the mornings at 11 euros each adult and 11 euros for the two girls.There was a very good choice of different foods from cereal and fruit to muffins and croissant. All the staff were helpful and friendly particularly the two bar staff. The situation of the hotel was ideal with the metro and bus stop right outside. Plenty to see also in walking distance of the hotel. I would certainly recommend the hotel and would stay there again if I made a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: thomasgirls
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from Saturday the 14th April for 4 nights. We took a taxi from the airport which cost 26 euros which I did not consider expensive. On arrival at the hotel we asked for a quiet room with twin beds, we were given room 655 which was spacious and spotlessly clean. Miguel the receptionist gave us a few tips on safety in the town and was very informative and helpful, we asked him a number of times about where things were and was given good advise. The hotel is perfectly placed for exploring the city as the tour buses and local buses have stops only a few minutes walk away. The tour buses are 24 euros and are fun way to explore the city, it's best to get on one early before they get too busy, they run til fairly late so it's good to go around the city as night falls the bull righ which is now a concert venue looks amazing lit up at night. Las Ramblas is about a 10 minute walk with lots of restaurants and bars off the side streets, some of these are a little bit seedy after dark so best to get a taxi or stick to the main roads where there always seemed to be a good police presence. We went by train from Sants station to Sitges which is beautiful with a lovely beach and excellent restaurants. A return ticked for an adult is 7.20 euros which is far cheaper than England the information office in the station have very helpful staff who speak good english. Breakfast in the hotel was good but very noisy at busy times and they did keep running out of cutlery. Overall a well placed hotel offering everything you need for a city break at a resonable price. I would use this hotel again and definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lynda G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights recently and having done our homework (by reviewing the hotel on this site) we were already aware of the possibility of noise from the nightclub and asked to be located in a quiet room to the rear of the hotel. This was no problem, and we were allocated room 104 on the first floor and we had no problems at all sleeping as we heard nothing at all! The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. We tried the hotel breakfast on the first morning and I would agree that it is quite pricey (11 euros) if you do not eat much at breakfast time. There are numerous cafe's across the road selling coffee and fresh orange juice and fresh pastries or filled croissants and baguettes for a fraction of the price if a smaller meal is all you require. We travelled to the hotel via the airport bus which takes you to the centre of Barcelona (place Catalunya) and costs just over 5 euros per person and takes around half an hour. From there take the metro to Paral lel which is literally right outside the hotel. A 10 journey ticket costs just over 9 euros and can be used by more than one person (there were 4 of us and we all used the same ticket, which can also be used on the local buses). The hotel is ideally placed for walking to the port or the ramblas and we had no problems walking back to the hotel later in the evening. Like any other big city it's just a case of taking care, and being aware of what's going on around you. I would say this hotel is a good option if you want a reasonably priced, conveniently located room for a short stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location however didn't live up to it's 4* rating”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have recently returned from our 4 day stay in Barcelona, on arrival the staff were very helpful and checked us into our room straight away. The staff gave us the option of a smoking/non smoking room, myself and partner opted for the smoking as we smoke. On enterance to the room the first look appeared ok, the room was clean. We had booked a double room however received a 3 single bed room, the mini fridge didn't work, there was no ashtray and there was no tea/coffee making facilities. The tiles in the bathroom were badly cracked and the television only had Spanish channels however the hotel states it has a full range of satellite tv channels, other than that the room was ok. The staff cleaned it daily, changed the bedding and supplied fresh towel, breakfast ran from 7am until 10:30, the variety of foods was exceptional, there was a variety of hot foods, fruit, cereals and bakery selections. The hotel was based in a great location just 2 blocks from the las ramblas which is full of great restaurants and souvenir shops, the locals were very friendly and the atmosphere was great, I'd recommend Barcelona as a place to go for any age group. The hotel was basic and I'd recommend people staying to check the rooms facilities prior to accepting the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimWfromNJ
Reviews.Content: OK, so leg two of my Spain vacation with my 3 children occurs in Barcelona. I have 2 girls and a boy (ages respectively are 16, 12 and 9). I think this will help people when planning especially those with children. What can I say, the Tryp Apollo was awesome. I had one little incident on my departure where the skinny woman at the front desk was rude (she took someone in front of me after seeing I was clearly there before the other woman who happened to be a native, I guess). Either way, I won't let that little incident ruin anything especially since the other gentleman (sorry I can't recall is name, but he's dark haired, with a mustache and a small beard and about 5' 5" with somewhat of a wave pattern in his hair) took good care of me and sent me on my way. Sorry, I digress :), but overall the Hotel was nicely located, easy access to the tour buses, which you can pay for in the hotel so you don't have to stand on line when you reach the tour bus (Barcelona City Tours, not Tourestic (sp)) location which is a few blocks away by the Barcelona Port, a few blocks up to La Rambla (which my kids loved), Metro L2 and Fenicular (sp) to Parc Montjuic are litterally right outside the door. There are a few eateries (cafeterias and restaurants right there as well). So location gets all thumbs up. Just be careful if you eat at Frederia (sp again, sorry), but it's like a block and a half to 2 blocks to the right of the hotel on the left-hand side. Food was good but they charged me 50 euros for paella. Guy said he didn't understand my order (yeah right, i think that's a trick to make more money from tourist). I'll leave a tip on how to order if you go there later on. Moving on, the hotel itself was clean and reasonably priced. Staff, overall was helpful (first day we got great directions, and area maps, and was told to watch our belongings). We knew that already but I was happy they told us anyway. We also got a good deal on the buffet which is a good option if you don't want the fuss with getting up and going out for breakfast with the kids daily. We had to microwave everything (but we found warm food is the norm in Barcelona so didn't find that odd, plus my kids like their eggs well done and their bacon). They had a nice assortment and their croissants were very tasty along with the fresh fruit and espresso :) Room was clean and kids loved the family room set up. We all had our own beds and they slept comfortably. They write on the mirror to welcome you and our room was themed with the Chimpmunks (cute). We also had a bidet (my son got a kick out of it and we all used it at least once, lol). Cleaning staff was very nice and accommodating. When we needed more towels they were delivered promptly and when they cleaned up they remembered to leave us what we needed daily. I guess the hotels don't really restock supplies, like shampoo and lotion unless requested. I thought that was odd when we first arrived but saw it was the same in Barcelona as what we experienced in Madrid. Food in the hotel is probably pricey for certain items but others are reasonable (such as the buffet). I paid 20 euros for plain vanilla helado for 4 people (that's a little much considering how much you can get it for up the block or at La Rambla). Not worth it! Just take the walk :) We used the mini bar to add coke to ours to make floats (coke from mini bar was 2 euros and agua con gas was 1.5 euro; again not bad but you can get it cheaper if you just walk up the block). So in summary, and sorry about being all over the place with this review, it was a great experience and I'd definitely go back to Tryp and because of this experience will consider visiting some of their other locations in the future. Hope my review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EscapingtheBurg
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I stayed at Tryp Apolo for three days while in Barcelona. It is a nice hotel with large rooms available. We requested a room for three and were given a suite with a king size bed and a roll-away bed for my daughter in the other room. This was fine for us as we were there to see the city and spent little time in the room. Our room was fairly low in the building and on the corner, one side facing Avinguid Paral-lel. Av. Paral-lel is a very busy street and street noise was a little bit of a problem as we were there over a weekend. The location was good but not great. To walk over to the port or to La Rambla it was at least 15 to 20 minutes which got a little old after three days. There is a Metro stop on the same block as the hotel. The room was nicely cleaned by the maid service everyday. The front desk staff all spoke English very well but some were not as helpful as they could have been. I had to go to the desk three times to get one problem resolved. On the other hand, we had the door handle on the bathroom break and maintenance came and repaired it right away. So I would say service was mixed. The breakfast room was very large and the variety of food was very good. The hotel had several large groups of students staying there at the time and the breakfast room could get crowded but the wait was not long. Free wi-fi is available but you have to get a password from the front desk every 24-hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: 216Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Tryp for one night before heading on a seven day Mediterranean cruise. Because we were only going to be in the city for approximately 24 hours we knew our focus would be on making sure we were close to all the action so we could hit the town running and of course we wanted to be close to the port. We didn't need anything fancy. After reading the Trip Advisor reviews, most thought the location was perfect especially if you are heading on a cruise and for the money it seemed a good value. When we arrived the staff was very friendly and offered restaurant suggestions for dinner in Port Olympia which was a short cab ride away. The hotel itself is very dated. It's no lap of luxury for sure. It's very basic and the rooms followed suit. They were on the small side and our double bed was literally two twin beds pushed together. Luckily for us it was only a one night stay so it worked well. We didn't spend much time in our room. We were within walking distance of just about everything. We spent the day walking around La Rambla and Port Olympia at night. Breakfast wasn't included with our room but we found a great little cafe close by and grabbed some food the next morning. We caught a cab to the port which was less than 10 minutes away. If you are looking for just a comfortable, clean place to rest your head then the Tryp Apolo isn't a bad option. You can't beat the location. If you are wanting a lot of amenities and a place worth telling all of your friends about you will be highly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location BUT”
Reviews.Author: L0calY0cal
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. We had a family room which great for our older children. The room were very clean. The breakfast was excellent with an assortment of fruit, meats and beverages. The location was great. However, it was very loud and close to a nightclub. Hords of kids in the street in the early morning hours celebrating the soccer win over Milan. Woke us up and went on for hours. The nightclub noise was a huge problem. At the hotels suggestion we dine across the street at the Restaurant Leone. The food was good but my son found a hair fried in along with his lamb chops! That ruined our dinner. Not impressed with our restaurant choices in Barcelona. Do some research before picking a restaurant.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel needs bringing into the 21st Century”
Reviews.Author: asykes1975
Reviews.Content: You will not get a better located hotel to all the tourist attractions Barcelona has to offer. It is a 5 minute walk to the modern Port Vella, La Rambla, maritime and historical museums, Plaza Catalunya (which is where all the tour buses set off from). We stayed for 2 nights room only from the 7th - 9th April. Whilst the hotel is comfortable, it is definately only a 2* + rather than a 4*. It is very basic and extremely old. The rooms are quite noisy also, lots of road noise. The interior is definately 1970's style. This is a shame as if the hotel is fully refurbished, no doubt this would be a jewel of a hotel. I would not recommend spending 18euro for breakfast either. There are hundreds of cafes within a couple of minutes walk offering english breakfasts and continental breakfasts alike for 5 - 10 euros and we found them to be excellent and value for money. Would stay here again if I was on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: Woodlands H
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nightclub for the locals. We stayed 3 nights Apr 3-6th 2012. On the 1st night, we thought it was a one off and didn't complain. A continuous stream of youths shouting to each other from about 12.30 am all the way through, continuously until 6.00 am. When I looked out of the window at 5.30 am, there were approximately 100 youths standing around in groups, singing, shouting, revving scooters as well as a stream of taxis viing for their business and beeping at each other. Every time a wave of youths drifted off and it began to get quieter, a fresh batch emerged from the nightclub. When I spoke to the front desk, they just said that i should ring them if it happened again and they would call the police. The stream of sirens would suggest that every guest in the hotel had done just that. No apologies from hotel. They clearly make enough money from the nightclub to offset the aggravation from the hotel guests. We had no sleep on any night. If you're stuck here, insist on an inner facing room.

Reviews.Title: “IT is a compromise”
Reviews.Author: nadeemk
Reviews.Content: staff ordinary - Taxi from airport takes 20 euros so proximity to airport no advantage-rooms ordinary-service ordinary-resaturant ordinary.I do not know why one should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Try to get a room away from the road!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona where we stayed at the Tryp Apolo for 3 nights on a B&B basis. Overall the hotel was well appointed but in need of some modernisation as the reception in particular looked a bit dated. All the staff we spoke to were very helpful and the breakfast buffet was very good indeed. As previous reviews have stated the location for the main marina and Rambla area was great just a few minutes walk although we were warned not to take any shortcuts through side streets. Also only 25 mins from the Airport so no long and expensive taxi rides needed. Our main concern was the noise from the road - we barely got a good nights sleep as the traffic and shouting from the streets and bars outside was very intrusive. Ask if you can get a room away from the main street if you want any peace and quiet....especially after Barcelano beat AC Milan! Main downside

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona City Break”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Michaela
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from 4 days in Barcelona and a stay at the TRYP Apolo. The Hotel is in a great location. It is a 5 minute walk from Las Ramblas and all the attractions off of it. The hotel has everything you need for a short break. The recpetion was quite modern with very helpful staff. The rooms have all your basic needs, very clean and very quiet. No complaints at all. The only English channel on the TV was BBC news but youre not there to watch TV so not a problem (the TV did have Barca TV though so 24hr football for those that want it). The bed and breakfast option is worth getting. Plenty of choice both hot and cold. A mixture of bacon and eggs, fruit, pastries and coffees etc. A good start to your day before exploring the city. Outside the hotel is the metro station. From here you can travel directly to near enough every sight of the city. One being the Camp Nou so if your staying in Barca for the football it is in a prime location. Overall a great place to stay and a great city to explore.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: DZEBORAH
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was very conveniently located - at walking distance - from my favourite spots in the city (especially Las Ramblas) and the metro stop is almost at the front door as well. The staff is warm and cordial, speaking almost every existing European language. I ordered room service a couple of times and it's the more varied menu I've ever seen anywhere. The room was comfortable and roomy with a great bed to sleep in. Very glad that I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: topbananaBristol
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at tryp apolo with a friend. I found the hotel very good, rooms were clean, beds comfortable and staff very helpful. We got a very good deal on last minute.com (even though we booked some time ago) which included breakfast for same price as room only. As you will see on here breakfast is normally 11 euros so would recommend looking for deals. Location was great, we got Metro everywhere, Parallel stop is practically right outside hotel. Much less busy than London underground. T10, the T10 journey ticket was €9.25 and could be used for both people at once. From airport you can get R2 train to Sants station and from there change to green L3 line for metro (all for one journey on the T10 so costs less than €1 compared to €40 quoted on here for taxi!!) Journey took approx 30mins? Would recommend visiting Las Ramblas, Barri Gotic, Sagrada Familia, Casa Batllo, Parc Guell, Camp Nou, Picasso Museum, Montjuic area (there is plenty to see and do up there and the teleferic cable car).The Tourist Bus is €24 for 1 day and €31 for 2 days, but you get a discount book which gave discount for entry on all the places we visited above.

Reviews.Title: “Good but too pricey...”
Reviews.Author: Bleehk
Reviews.Content: I was here for 1 night as it was a busniess trip, i have stayed here before as the connections are good for airport and central barcelona. I am glad they finally offer free Wifi, and the connection is good. The prices are higher than other hotels in the area, i cannot complain about the service or the rooms. All in all I just think that they charge very high prices for something that is a standard hotel, i compare this to other hotels of the same standard and are 15/20% cheaper. Will look for a cheaper option in the area next time....

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel!!? You are joking!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnm131
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mother last weekend. It was a surprise outing for me and by god what an absolute lack of professionalism this hotel employs. Front desk on check in had two male Receptionists. Miguel (?) who checked us in told us we had a free minibar which appeared a little odd but once I had entered the room noticing there was no tea making facilities (4* Hotel!!??) I assumed immediately the free mini bar was to compensate for that so no more thought on it. On the Saturday we arrived back very late in the afternoon to discover our room had not been serviced and the window wide open giving us reason to suspect the room had been broken into, the maids' argument for the non service was that there was a 'do not disturb' on the door which neither myself or my mother had placed. However once the front desk was informed, the room was serviced quite quickly. Check out was a 'hysterical' had it not been for real. Raul the very obnoxiously rude Receptionist continue to argue with my mother at the desk when other guests were checking out. This came when he insisted we had to pay for the mini bar which we declined to accept as we were originally told we had a free mini bar, he then proceeded to shout over to my mother as she was walking away from the desk that he would take money from her Credit Card, this again was in front of other guests checking out. The same Duty Manager as the on the afternoon before denied being on duty that time. I work in a 4 star hotel with much higher standards compared to the Apolo hotel. Leaving that hotel I was absolutely stunned with their lack of training, professionalism and obvious have not got the clue that the 'customer is always right' Room itself - very basic but more of a 2/3 * standard, no decent TV, carpets worn and dirty and broken window. Very noisy with the traffic day and night. Breakfast - basic and I suppose edible but could be better, coffee was stone cold each day. Could also do with more staff on busier periods. Won't return ever....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible --- huge mistake to stay here”
Reviews.Author: carly1340
Reviews.Content: Expedia showed "family Rm - w/ 2 bunks" but hotel won't let you put teenagers in the bed. Photos are misleading. At 5 pm, told the hotel that the Safe didn't work, and the phones in the room were dead, and when we returned at midnight, nothing was fixed. At midnight they offered to move us to the first floor. Not good because there is a huge nightclub with lines around the hotel building, so it's noisy. Not a good place for kids. The staff is very stingy with the wifi passwords. The hotel is in a shady neighborhood, especially for families. There is a red light district near the hotel. Do not walk through these streets on the way to La Rambla. There are porn shows right across the street. No soar in bathroom, shower temp changes all the time. Hair dryer didn't work, they are stingy with towels, hallways smelly, smoky, dirty carpet, one step up from a college dormitory. Concierge, front desk, and check-in person are all one-in-the same. Expect huge long lines.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Tristan331
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days. Very nice, clean, free wifi (definite plus). Location was good - about a 7-10 min walk to Las Ramblas, the tour buses, and Plaza Espana. About a 15 minute walk to Plaza Cataluna. Metro is down the block. Take advantage of the delicous and plentiful breakfast buffet as good food in Barcelona is not so readily available contrary to what we thought going there. Also, it's helpful to do some research about what you want to see before hand because while the staff are friendly and try to be helpful, it's a very busy hotel so you have limited time to ask questions. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Apolo”
Reviews.Author: Stephen T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Bathroom a bit tired, room spacious and clean. A little noise from street. No-one serving at bar at 11pm. Very Good location. 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas and Port. Metro and Fenincular on doorstep. Had a fantastic time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, value for money. Well located, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: denzoe21
Reviews.Content: A basic but clean room. Great location for the metro and ramblas. Lots of amenities nearby. Great value for money, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sammie4
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience of staying at a Tryp hotel and overall it did not disappoint. The hotel is located on avenue Parallel, between the districts of Poble Sec and El Raval. The metro is only a stones throw away & only a few stops from the Ramblas. The reception staff were always on hand when required and allowed us a very early check-in which after a very early start was a godsend. The rooms were comfortable & the beds heavenly, the bathroom was clean & spaceous with an endless supply of toiletries. Breakfast was reasonably priced (EUR11 per day) but a little manic at times, but this was expected during the valentines period. The selection was satisfactory even though there were times when the waiting staff (one) struggled to clear tables with the hugh influx of guests that arrived for breakfast each morning. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again and am looking forward to my next trip to BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected”
Reviews.Author: AdolfoB
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at Tryp hotels and experience is normally good. With this one, not. Despite the good location and check in/out service, rooms need urgent renovation, especially in the bathrooms - old, dirty, broken !!! Not really what you expect for a hotel Tryp (or Melia). Location is good, just in the corner of the Paral-lel metro station and from a walking distance to La Rambla and some major see's in the city. Breakfast is regular, but overcrowded and sometimes staff cannot replace all in time, so you can expect dirty tables, lack of glasses, dishes, food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: just back from lovely weekend 24th to 27th Feb. Great position for metro and La Rambla. Staff on reception were very helpful, excellent breakfast hot and cold buffet. Rooms were lovely and clean and lovely and quiet! I would strongly recommend and definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: joodeoxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Having read quite a few reviews that were a bit negative we decided to stay at The Apolo and were glad we did. It is in a great postition for the Metro and bus. Perfect for walking to just about anywhere. Our room was very quiet and very clean. Bath towels were huge and not hankerchief size! Best of all were the staff. They were all so pleasant, helpfull and nearly always a smile. Astrid, Ryan Ford and Jorge were really helpful. Having travelled many places in the world and backpacked with no problems ever I get my purse stolen on the beach in Barcelona. I never saw who it was but plain clothes police and a witness saw it and the person dropped my rucksack, but had taken my purse (wallet) and mobile phone in it before running off.. We were asked to go the police station near the hotel and make a statement which we did.The police on the beach were very apologetic about what happened. The police station was helpful and there was a freephone to get hold of the credit card companies and cancel. The thieves got my mobile phone as well and that was cancelled as well with the help of the staff at the hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for them, The police station was busy with people who were in the same position as myself so even though you are warned be very very careful. The hotel has safes that are free in the rooms and that is fantastic.Our passports etc. were safe all day we were out. The thieving happened the day we were to return home and were on the beach staring at the sea and that is one of the places they get you. I was warned to be aware but took my eye off the ball. We did not query at the hotel if there was somewhere to leave our passports etc. after vacating a room. Our luggage was locked in a room by the porter and we were given a claim check. Maybe there was somewhere safe to leave our valuables during the day as our flight was an evening one. Our deal included breakfast and it was a really good one with a good variety of foods and presentation. The lobby is not very exciting quite large and austere, but that could be improved upon in time. Most important were the helpful members of staff we met. My husband will write a review too onmwhat he thinks of the Apolo Hotel Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with fenomenal breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MarSod61
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two teenage sons in a family room. The room was actually two large rooms with a connecting door, so we had one room with a kingsize bed and the children one with twin beds. Really comfortable beds and plenty of pillows. Very nice bathroom with many towels. The wall-mounted hair dryer was bad, so bring your own. Best of all, was the breakfast buffet. It was the best I've ever eaten with lots of fruits, juices, pastries, eggs, bacon, cheeses and cured meats. The breakfast was not included in the price, and was quite expensive - but considering what you got for your money, it was clearly affordable. The position of the hotel was optimal. Close to the harbor, La Rambla and the metro. Many good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - A Few Slight Faults”
Reviews.Author: Garnett47
Reviews.Content: Just back from Tryp Apolo, spent 4 nights 20 to 24 Feb. Room facing Para-lel - noise not a problem. TV in room all foreign However you can change the Audio settings to change American movies and programmes to english - great when it`s half 11 and you need some tv. Lux soap for a bath and sink wash, also comb, toothbrush + paste + womens Intimate Kit, Tampon I think. Fridge great for wine and beer, just move out there`s. Safe in room good. Breakfast is on floor 1 - Eggs, scrambled, boiled, fried. Bacon, sausages, mushrooms, tomatoes, toast. Yogurts, pears bananas apples, ham cheeses lettuce, baps galore. All bran corn flakes sugar puffs nuts raisins. Juices Pineapple Apple Orange Tomato. Coffee galore, all teas you will need. Enough said. Great start to the day. Hotel bar charges 5 euro a pint of local beer, local rough type Supermarket across the road is 4 euro for 6 large tins of local beer. Metro outside, easy to use. Hotel WI-FI Free at the minute but slow. Outside the hotel is a little seedy but you can use the local shops during the day, buy some snacks and wines beers etc down Nou De La Ramble, prices cheap. Dinner in La Rambla is a Rip-Off. Go to Gothic Quarter and go to Dunnes Irish Bar - good value and get the british sport on tv. I would go back as I know the hotel and area now.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony P
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect myself and my partner. If I had to pick any sort of negatives for our own personal wants and needs then it would be the lack of English channel on TV (one channel, BBC World News). Im used to dated decor on my European travels but a worn out toilet seat was a bit much even my my standards. We had a room overlooking the main road, being a young couple who are partial to a bit of noise and a bit of people watching this was great for us, noise was only ever apparent when sirens went past however. On our last night we fell upon a parade going directly down the road outside of our hotel so we had some great views of that. Parrel-lel Metro station is just outside the reception. I suggest you get the T-10 ticket, which is 10 journeys for just 9.25 Euro which can be used by you and your partner, otherwise you will pay up to 2 Euro for a single journey. We used three T-10 tickets but connection trains do not use up a journey as you are already within a station, this was great as we travelled everywhere via metro. La Rambla is across the road and down a small side street for roughly 3 blocks, we ventured it twice but never ate or drank on the strip cos prices were steep as expected, although the fruit juices in the market were a welcome morning after the night before refreshment. Luckily my partner speaks fluent Spanish and having friends that have lived here we were able to locate recommended restaurants. The Gracia area of the city flaunts the largest and highest quality of places to eat, I recommend 'Taller de Tapas' (get metro to Passeig de Gracia) which is on the same train line as the hotel metro station and was alos in the New York Times for its award winning food. Barceloneta is the beach front area, its a 15 minute walk away, with a work through Port Vell and then afterwards to Port Olimpica it was one of the enjoyable walks iv'e ever experience. One of my regrets was not getting the one of the bikes that are located throughout the city (and outside hotel) where you can just pop off and then park it up in the nearest bike rank to your desired destination, this is very popular amongst locals. To summarise, hotel rooms were value for money, locate was more than perfect and receptionist and other members of staff were a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: Although showing signs of much use, this hotel was well run and very convenient for the city. Metro and bus connections were perfect, both being directly outside the front door. Breakfast required careful choice...the hot side was not impressive, but the fruit and cold food was excellent. Rooms were well appointed and there was ample running hot water at all times of the day. The hotel is adjacent to a night club; the sound proofing of the windows is not bad, but noisy youth could be intrusive at times. Apparently this is a problem bedevilling large areas of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Well located - reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Davehere
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a package deal. Nicely priced and very comfortable. Best was the location just a few blocks off the Ramblas. Desk staff agreeable. Can't comment on restaurant as we dined around town. Didn't spend much time in room except to clean up and sleep but it was fine. Soundproofing from room to room could be a little better but the excited group of young ladies in the next room could have been an anomaly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for City Break”
Reviews.Author: Jannersally
Reviews.Content: We booked with Last Minute .com on their secret Hotel deal and were very pleased with the overall standard of the Hotel. It ticked all the boxes - good value, good location, clean, comfortable and friendly staff, The buffet breakfast was excellent and well worth 11 euros, payable at reception. We walked to all the major sights, apart from the cable car to Montjuic. You can also get to the airport on a Metro ticket, much cheaper than a taxi, even for 4 people. There is a vast choice for eating out nearby, by far the best places were in the side streets OFF the Ramblas! Restaurant Can Culleretes is about a15 min walk away and is excellent with great atmosphere and wonderful paella, seafood and steak. Arrive before they open (9pm) and you should get a table. Agree with previous reviewers - get a room at the back of the hotel, the front overlooks a very busy, wide road. We would happily return!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guma_77
Reviews.Content: Rooms represent fairly good value for money although, as mentioned by others, the furnishings are a bit worn out. The hotel definitely needs refurbishing to fully fit in the 4* standards. Breakfasts are great. You get a decent choice of cold cuts and local treats.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NicolaMartin1
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for my summer holidays. Hotel is in a great location and hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, yet showing its age.”
Reviews.Author: Martinzz
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits smack on a metro station, plus it is very easy to access from the airport by car (the hotel has its own garage). Once inside, however, signs of age cannot be overlooked even in so-called superior rooms. The carpets are terribly worn, tiles in the bathroom are cracked and the bathroom fittings look like having been installed by a first-month apprentice - everything is misaligned. Moreover, rooms facing the main avenue get a serious amount of street noise. On the other hand, breakfast is plentiful and very varied, and the bed in my room was really comfy. Once the overhaul is done, it will be a great place. Until then, watch out.

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced, reasonably comfortable”
Reviews.Author: IsidoraS
Reviews.Content: Without much charm, more of a 3* than a 4*, this hotel offers relatively comfortable rooms at a reasonable price. Rooms are spatious and fairly clean, and similarly for the bathroom; you get more or less what you'd expect (...from a 3* hotel). Breakfast is OK - again, in a large room without much charm, but decent choice and reasonably good quality. The hotel is on avenue Parallel, between the districts of Poble Sec and El Raval. It might not be an ideal choice for someone coming to Barcelona for a first time and for short; but if you know your way around, the location may have its advantages; some nice cafés and restaurants in Poble Sec, interesting places in El Raval. If you want wi-fi, you can only get a 24h subscription and it's ridiculously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “TIRED, WORN & IN NEED OF A REVAMP TO BE PLUGGING AS A 4* HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Southshields_DAVE
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed in a few Sol/Tryp hotels throughout Spain I was very sceptical reading the reviews of the Tryp Apolo as to date I’ve always only ever had good experiences of them, Unfortunately, The reviews are a true representation folks! I’m sorry to say Tryp Apolo that you must clinging on to your 4* rating by the skin of your teeth because this hotel needs some serious investment and a major revamp to keep the 4* status and be dragged into 2012! We stayed in a standard double room so I can’t comment on the Superior rooms, Fitness rooms or suites etc…. I like Tryp/Sol hotels for two reasons, 1, You always get a fridge in the room (to chill your cheap supermarket beers prior to heading out on a night, The Condis supermarket is turn right out of the hotel then 2 main streets up then turn right approx 2 mins walk open until 9.30pm) 2, The bathrooms are spotless and really clean, However, Staying at the Apolo you do get the fridge but not the latter I’m afraid as the bathroom was extremely shabby, discoloured grout, bath plug not attached to the chain, cracked tiles and all the stainless steel fittings have been worn through to expose the brass underneath! Panelled dark wood all over the room feels very 70’s indeed, Only 2 english channels on the TV, BBC world news and Russia today, Unless you can get this hotel at a cracking price i.e. No more than £65 per night RO then I would seriously look at a 3* elsewhere for similar money!! We stayed RO basis so I couldn’t comment on the Breakfast or evening meal dining experience, Although, we did eat in a couple of the local bar restaurants right opposite the hotel, The Bar El Rincon Del Artista and the Fashion restaurant, Which were both a very pleasant experience, decent food at a good price. As for breakfast save your money as any café in the vicinity does coffee & croissant for €2euros. Also, Save you taxi fares as the hotel is in a great location for La rambla/City centre approx 10 mins walk straight down the road opposite the hotel, Carrer Nou de la Rambla, It’s also really safe walking back late at night as the street is a hub of activity with bars/cafes/supermarkets all open late and there is also a police headquarters on the street, Metro stop (Parallel) right outside the hotel for ease of getting around to see the sights of Barcelona and one of the lines actually takes you direct to Sagrada Familia. I will definitely be returning to Barcelona to finish off the sights I missed but sorry to say I won’t be staying in Tryp Apolo!

Reviews.Title: “"Happy Birthday" & "Thank you Miguel"”
Reviews.Author: kaljeerh
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Had a terrible experience arriving as the cab driver charged us €40 from the airport!! (anyone reading this please catch the Airport bus to and from La Ramblas for only €12 return) After that the experience was "Fantastic". Nice room on the 3rd floor, had a problem with the shower, which was sorted within 5mins. We were given some great advice that evening on where and how to go about the city. Miguel, was an asset to the hotel was very helpful, he was brilliant on organising restaurants and even got us VIP into "Opium Mar" the best nightclub in the city!! Breakfast was brilliant and well worth the extra money. This hotel is 10mins walk from La Ramblas and ideal for a city break. I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona. Thanks for making my Birthday one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: drawoha
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip follwed by a mini weekend break. The hotel is well situated with the Metro station a few paces from the main door. The harbour area is a 20 min walk and the Ramblas is a similar distance. My room was on the 5th floor facing the main Paral-lel steet which is busy and can be noisy at night ( road traffic & party people). Up side was I had a view; down-side was noise so maybe a room at the back of the hotel would be quieter. Breakfast was good - variety and quality. Reception staff were very approachable and helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good hotel but it has deteriorated since my last stay”
Reviews.Author: Biscas
Reviews.Content: Two years ago, I stayed at this hotel and the experience was great. I was expecting a great stay but that was not the case. First of all, I requested a non-smokers room and was given a room on the 4th floor facing the busy "Parallel" street. Well, the room smelled like a cheap smoker's heaven lounge. Bit since it was still very early in the afternoon, I left the window open hoping that when I returned it would tolerable. In the evening, when I arrived, the room did not smell any better so I asked for another room. The receptionist took care of the issue and apologized for the inconvenience (great staff!!!). I was given room 466 (I think) and the difference was amazing. Up to this point, all was OK. The problem was from 01:00 till about 04:00 during which time it was very difficult to get some sleep. The room is facing a street with a casino entrance and that night there was loud yelling and confusion (taking into account the number of security personnel all around, this is most likely the norm every night!). Furthermore, being a 4 star hotel, it should also start thinking about revamping since virtually everything is starting to look worn out. The hotel should also think about improving its bar area since even the TV is in bad shape. Overall, it is still a well situated and OK hotel but Barcelona has a lot from where to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “cold breakfast!!! clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mobius19
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Barcelona, nice city, very nice architecture, especially la sagrada familia. The main street La Rambla very tourist orientated go there once or twice then go some were else in the city. The hotel was very clean and well priced, modern in 92 but its 2012 now and the Olympics have moved on to better things, could do with a new look. Rooms were big, bathroom good and clean, shower stayed hot. ok on 2 the bad point, the hot parts of the breakfast were stone cold. cold bacon, cold eggs and cold Spanish omelette. The hot lamps were not on or not working. there was a microwave oven to use but why should I warm up what should already be hot, not good. on a good point what was suppose to be cold was well presented and nice to eat.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Julia S
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Barcelona and certainly will not be our last. From the moment we landed until the moment we left everything was perfect. The hotel was fantastic. Every member of staff was polite and helpful especially Miguel and Caroline on receptioin to name but a few.Our room was clean and comfortable,based on the 6th floor facing the main road we enjoyed fantastic views and were not bothered by any noise. We were able to check in early and upon departure we were able to leave our luggage in a secure room until we needed to head back to the airport, We opted to have breakast at a cost of 11 euros each per day which was well worth it as there was plenty of choice both hot and cold and the staff were constantly making sure nothing ran out. Location was perfect for La Rambla the port and many other wonderful sights, Sagrada Famila is an absolute must and camp nou, even if you are not a football fan is worth a visit. Transport is excellent in Barcelona which makes it easy to get around. We will certainly use this hotel again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Majid M
Reviews.Content: Before my wife and I go to this hotel ,we found some bad comments about this hotel in this website.My wife had bad impression and she was waiting to face a bad hotel a really bad hotel. But everything was changes. When we saw the hotel and stepped in ,All our imaginations was changed. 1- the Attitude of reception was very good and they were very helpful with lots of patients. 2-Hotel has a security guard in lobby(This is what was mentioned here). 3- Despite of some comments that mentioned there wasn't any security guard and there was a rubbery inside the hotel, we didn't see anything inside the hotel. 4)The room that we had was very quiet and there was noises just from our neighbor rooms like the other hotels. 5)The location of the hotel is fantastic,around the hotel there is so much markets that you can buy anything you want.on the other side or in the hotel side. 6) Five minutes walk from hotel to the famous street "Ra lambla". it is in the other side of hotel. 7)From hotel to the beach is ten to fifteen minutes by walk and the are is really fantastic and lovely. 8)Outside the hotel at the morning ,there is always some cabs that makes it easy when you want to go to airport. at the end,I recommend this hotel for Barcelona and if we want to go there next time, we will choose this hotel again,

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in the hearth of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Annet_Rome
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really a good bargain! We found a good offer and spent a fabulous weekend. The room was big, clean and extremely confortable, perfect for our romantic trip. You can also decide to have breackfast in your room instead of at the restaurant without paying extra fees. Subway is just in front of the main entrance and however, it's just 10 minutes walking from the Ramblas in a perfect position to sightsee the city and near the seaside also. In addition, people there were extremely kind and helpful. I strongly reccomend this hotel, they made us have a very amazing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for price and location!”
Reviews.Author: Danr7124
Reviews.Content: slightly concerned by some of the reviews before we went however we were more than happy with our stay at Tryp Barcelona Apolo. The Hotel was clean and well kept. The food at breakfast was fantastic, varied and fresh. I cant believe some people on here have said the staff were rude because we found the reception staff polite, friendly and more than happy to help. the cleaners would say hola to us every morning and as they say its the little things like that which make a stay particularly pleasant. The bar man was a really nice chap and deserves a special mention. the location was fantastic, the tube stop is right outside the hotel door and the port, la rambla is a few minutes walk away. Overall we were very happy and would have no problem staying here again when we next visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “ok for price”
Reviews.Author: sandra a
Reviews.Content: Booked via lastminute and had 4 nights incl flights for under £500. Certainly not 4 star as we know it. Stayed in room 208 and bathroom in dire need of refurbishment. Good points the room was clean and the breakfast plentiful. Enjoyed a drink in the bar on our last night. Location not bad either. Not a hotel I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Careful of noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ssk09
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine if a little bland. There is no on site gym and although you can use a gym next door the opening times are limited. So you can't use the gym before 9am or in the evening. Rooms facing the road are noisy at night because of the local clubs etc and the rooms are hot. The air on just doesn't seem to work. It's not terrible but there must be better

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Iuliana S
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through expedia.co.uk. As soon as we checked in, the receptionist recommended us to take advantage of the special breakfast offer: just £10/person/day instead of £20. We passed, and did a good thing: there are lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood where you can get much better value (full English breakfast for 5 euro or coffee and croissant or toast for 2 euro). We stayed in a double room on the third floor. The bedding and towels were changed daily, but the room was never dusted or vacuumed for the duration of our stay (my husband even left me a love message on the window the day we arrived - the dust was that thick - and it was still there when we checked out). On the third day of our stay, the electricity suddently went off. When we went to enquire, we saw a notice in the hall next to the elevator door saying there is maintenance work being done, but we were not warned in advance. Do not recommend the rooms facing the main road since they can be very noisy in the early hours of the day. Also, the AC unit was noisy and not very effective. On the bright side, there was everything you could need in the bathroom-from toothbrush to shoe shine. The location is excellent - walking distance to La Rambla, Gothic Quarter, Magic Fountain and the beach. The tube station is right outside the hotel. Very easy to get to the hotel to and from the airport. Would not chose to stay here again, there planty of hotels and hostels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I reccommend this hotel as a decent value.”
Reviews.Author: Aguiladeacero
Reviews.Content: We booked this via Hotwire and were a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews here. However, those fears were unfounded. The location is very convenient and the accommodations are spacious. Very easy to get to Montjuic and to Las Ramblas. The Para-lel Metro stop is literally just a few steps away. The furnishings were a bit worn in our room but everything was very clean. I suspect this hotel was built for the Olympics in 1992 (it's at the Metro stop for the funicular to Montjuic which is where the stadium is) and has not been updated since. We gave the housekeeper a Euro or two tip every day and the room was cleaned and made up very nicely every day. We requested an interior room because of some of the other reviews on this site. Noise was not a problem. They offer a breakfast with a discount if you buy it for your entire stay at check-in. The price for each breakfast was high (18 euros) if you don't buy it then for your stay. But after we declined the breakfast, the person at the check in desk offered ups an opportunity to sign up for the "Mas" affiliation program. With that you can get the breakfast for 9 euros per person per day for only the days you want it. We had the breakfast for two mornings. It was good and in my opinion worth the cost for a cafeteria type breakfast, Finally, as been noted in other reviews, some areas of el Raval are somewhat sketchy. But the area immediately around the hotel is fine, and if you walk along the Carrer Nou de la Rambla to get to La Rambla, I doubt you will have a problem there. There is a police station on that street. I live in New York City and I see el Raval as analogous to the Lower East Side of Manhattan. It is obviously an area they are trying to improve, although they may have been somewhat thwarted for now by the financial crisis in Spain. Check out the cat statue on Rambla del Raval if you get a chance. It was nice to have these accommodations in such a location at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “not so good, but location is good.”
Reviews.Author: Peter_on_trip
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a few times as the location is good and price seems attractive, still this hotel is not really good and the rooms seems too old.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: nomadicdg
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place - a little souless possibly. The location is excellent and the breakfast comprehensive and plentiful. Room was cleaned impeccably. Service probably was the only thing letting this place down - it lacked the personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but bad service”
Reviews.Author: Johnny234
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located and had excellent sights. However we had a bad experience with a receptionist called Raul, he was very rude and sarcastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great staff, decent room”
Reviews.Author: Shystee
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 2 nights in December, booked via Lastminute - I found the two reception staff exceptional. Ryan Ford and Miguiz. The gave sound advice on what was worth doing and seeing in my short stay and went above and beyond to help organise football tickets and even got me free entry into one of barcelona's top night club venues. Both spoke good english. The Rooms at the hotel are of a good standard, although the bathroom was in need of some repair. the Wireless price of 17euros for 24 hours is beyond a joke, that would be my only moan. It was cheaper to upgrade my room and get free wifi! I would definitely stay here again - when i return to the great city.

Reviews.Title: “central location, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: elenarf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was arranged by our travel agency and it proved to be an excellent one. It was walking distance to sights we wanted to see and public transportation was right on the doorstep. The room was comfortable and clean, and an awesome breakfast buffet was a part of the package.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Mary1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights 1st week in December. We had booked on last minute.com and got a good deal including flights. We found the check-in experience very pleasant with the young man helpful speaking very good English, he gave us a map and explained how to get to the main tourist areas. We had arrived a bit early for check in but that was no problem and got our room right away. The room was fine, perfectly adequate for a short stay and situated at the back as requested. It was cleaned every day to a high standard and we never experienced anything to complain about during our stay. Breakfast was very good if a little crowded later in the morning. If you want to avoid the crowds go earlier. We only had one drink in the bar and didn't use any other hotel facilities as we we only really used the room for sleeping. The location of the hotel was perfect either for walking or using the underground. I would go back to this hotel on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Pick the correct side”
Reviews.Author: Tripledan81
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good and the rooms are clean. However, one side of the hotel faces a very noisy street (especially on the weekends). We tried to switch rooms but the only room they had available that didn't face the noisy street side was a smoking room. We also asked the front desk how to get Barcelona tickets and they quoted us a price and said they can have them delivered to the hotel. However, if you get the tickets straight from Nou Camp stadium, they are much cheaper (almost 40% off). Lastly, the staff at the front desk also gave us a pretty poor recommendation on our first dinner in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Stay”
Reviews.Author: SharkWidnes
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay and were very impressed with this hotel. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us lots of information, advice and tips on what to see and do and how to get around. The room was lovely and spacious, very clean and well equipped and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was brilliant as there was so many different choices and everything was fresh. This hotel is the perfect base to see Barcelona, TIPS. Request a room at the back of the hotel they are much quieter as the front of the hotel is on a busy main road. I would reccomend the two day ticket for the hop on hop off tour bus as you would never see it all in one day. If Barcelona are playing at home during your visit go and watch them, the stadium is fantastic and the atmosphere is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Davide L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in November and I must say I was very impressed. On arrival the reception desk was brilliant, Ryan Evan was particulary good, upgrading our room because of my girlfriends birthday the following was first class customer service, thank you Ryan. The room was spacious with great views, breakfast was plentiful with a variety of options. Location was within walking distance of the ramblas and many other attractions. Would certainly return and thanks again for a marvellous stay

Reviews.Title: “Very a good value”
Reviews.Author: SimonDallas
Reviews.Content: I had a good bargan with five nights stay. With this price, I would highly recomand this hotel to any one visiting Barcelona. The room is clean and confortable. The elevator to the metro entrence and bus stop is right in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Long Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: RogLinds
Reviews.Content: Good location, convenient for the Port, Montjuic and the Ramblas. Clean room with comfortable beds, lots of freebie toiletries in the en-suite and a big flat screen television (no English language channels though). Breakfast was OK with a large selection although on 2 mornings out of 3, bacon & fried eggs were stone cold. Tip: Breakfast cost reduces from 18 to 11 euros if you book it on arrival. Overall, a good place for a short break to explore Barcelona (a fascinating city).

Reviews.Title: “At first I thought it was my jet lag...”
Reviews.Author: MaureenWA
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel for a couple of days in Barcelona pre-cruise. What a disaster!!! First of all I was given a smoking room on the second floor right above lots of street noise. The front desk could not have been less helpful. Some events in my 3 day stay...got them to move my room after I said I would start screaming...after first day my room key no longer worked...another trip to the desk and equally rude attitude...hot and humid in Nov. with windows that did not open.No air conditioning. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: FussyMcB
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel in a great location for exploring with a metro right outside. The rooms are fairly plush. We had a standard double for two nights and compared to many other european hotels the standards were quite high. The bed was comfortable with decent pillows and a good selection of complimentary toiletries in the en suite. We would recommend that future guests request a room at the back of the hotel as we were overlooking the busy main road at the front. There was also a lively bar immediately opposite which appeared to stay opened all night on Friday and Saturday. Consequently when the traffic noise stopped for the night we were kept awake by the noise from the bar until after 4am. On a more positive note it is only 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and really easy to get to from the airport. Take the train to Barcelona Sants at 3.15 euro per person then swap to the metro and take the green line to Parallel. The hotel bar is not overly expensive but look out for some odd extra charges levied by the unfriendly reception staff when you check out. They charged us an extra euro because they said we did not have the correct paperowrk when we checked in. This was not true but we felt guilty accepting the refund offered when they said it goes to help poor children and told them to keep the euro.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Jliss10149
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there in October pre cruise one night. Due to nightclub right under hotel we never got to sleep. Terrible noise including police arriving until 5:30 am. No air conditioning and it was hot. Hotel would not move our room. Front desk personnel were not friendly and downright rude. If you are booked, cancel. Plenty of better hotels. Breakfast buffet was cold! If this was only hotel Iwould never go back to Barcelona. Room had odor although just cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: ttravelingallthetime
Reviews.Content: this is an excellent location when you are very limited on time and just are able to get a quick view of barcelona. it is close to the airport and the cruise terminal which can save you money when you are going from point a to b. had no issues with hotel it was what we expected nothing fantastic but nothing terrible either. good little walking around area to see a few things before dark. would certainly stay here on a return trip to see the city of barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was fine .”
Reviews.Author: DarHiggz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there and had no problems with our room . No noises and the area felt very safe compared to some parts of Barcelona . The first person I dealt with at the desk wasn't overly friendly and his english wasn't great , the the other guy I talked to was fine . Maybe the first guy was new ?? It might be close to the subway but stay away from the subway unless you want your pockets picked .

Reviews.Title: “cold room, stinky carpets, slow internet.”
Reviews.Author: Zalupa
Reviews.Content: the room was cold even I turned the valve up. The hotel smells like it is 400 old place. Upgrated Internet for 10 Euros/ day for high speed, they charged me but worked like dial-up.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Linda121
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel within walking distance of restaurants and attractions. We stayed here one night prior to our Mediterranean cruise and found it to be a great choice. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. After a long flight from Phoenix we were very tired but still wanted to see Barcelona. It was a short walk from the hotel to the Olympic Port, the Columbus Monument and Las Ramblas. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mzz36f
Reviews.Content: The rooms and breakfast were excellent but the staff at the front desk were not very friendly or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “First stay in a European hotel”
Reviews.Author: LydiaGwaltney
Reviews.Content: I really had no idea what to expect from a European hotel, having usually traveled by cruise ship when in Europe. I had heard stories that ran the gamut from horrible to almost as good as American hotels. I was very pleased with our room. It was very clean, well laid-out and relatively quiet (except for some street noise, which is unavoidable). The only negatives were that there was no bar soap or wash cloths in the room. Perhaps those are "luxuries" that we Americans have come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: SanchoPanza07
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here and found it to be a reasonable hotel. The location is good for connections as it has a metro stop outside and is on the very large Avinguda del Para-lel so it’s also easy to reach by taxi (there’s a regular queue of taxis outside the hotel too), there are bus stops nearby and it’s very easy to get about on foot. It’s a 5-10 minute walk to the end of the avenue to reach the harbour and the bottom end of La Rambla or you can cut across on the Carrer Nou de la Rambla which takes around 10 mins to put you in the centre of La Rambla. I would point out if not known already that between the hotel and La Rambla and the Barri Gotic areas is El Raval which, although generally fine, still retains a bit of an edge in parts and the Carrer Nou is part of it. We had a room on the 5th floor looking out at the back towards Montjuic and there was no noise whatsoever from outside or internally. The room and bathroom were spacious, spotless, modern and well equipped (large tv, safe (that we couldn’t get to work), iron & board, tea & coffee facilities etc). The bed was extremely comfortable with lovely sheets and pillows. The hotel’s wifi has to be paid for but on the plus side there is free access to a gym just around the corner. We didn’t eat at the hotel as it was a €19 supplement for breakfast and found it easy enough to walk out to get something to eat. We encountered a few staff during the stay, housekeeping were friendly and the receptionist on check in was fine, but the guys who handled our check out and a query when our room key wouldn’t work both had a bit of an air of attitude. Overall, the room was great and met the room rate, but the location being slightly off-centre, the expensive breakfast and wifi, and the occasional perceived lack of friendliness from the staff takes this hotel from being great to just being good. I think that for a return trip to Barcelona I would stay at another hotel that I had stayed at on an earlier visit and preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Bingy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed/staying 5-9th Nov, on arrival was allowed to check-in to the hotel early with no problems. Room was of an excellent size, place to put the case, lots of wardrobe space to put clothes. Buffet breakfast was included which slightly changed daily with a varied choice of meats, cheese eggs three ways cereals and breads, yogurts and fruit. You listen to muppets on here with their reviews and you wonder what people expect.....I've stayed in 5 star in London (Dorchester) which was fantastic and I payed for it, which I have no qualms, I have no qualms with the Apolo and what I've payed, i.e. you get what you pay for. Would most definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Robbery”
Reviews.Author: Evelyne H
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience at the tryp apolo hotel in Barcelona. When I arrived in the hotel my purse was stolen by a thief. It was clearly filmed on camera and there was a security officer present at the place, but no one reacted even when I started screaming for help, nobody helped us. Then I got angry and and the first reaction of the recepcion was that it happens all the time in the hotel... Four days later at the checkout a had an agry talk with the manager about the complete lack of security in the hotel and somebody overheared us and came to us to tell that his friend was also robbed in the hotel just an hour before. SO the hotel KNOWS about the poor security and doesn't even care enough to take measurements!!! DON'T GO TO THIS HOTEL, unless you want to get robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean. Noisy location”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinCruisin09
Reviews.Content: We came here because it was a Carnival cruise approved hotel. One positive about this hotel was they got us into our room ahead of check-in time. On the downside, the rooms weren't very clean. The carpets and chair fabric were stained and the shower fixtures were rusting. Parallel avenue where our room was facing is very busy and noisy even later in the evening. The area is rundown. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona break”
Reviews.Author: Womble92
Reviews.Content: Very happy with hotel. Spacious room with good air con unit (for October weather was hot!) Had room at side of building, didn't find it noisy at all. Hotel close to an underground station, but we didn't use it at all, restaurants & shopping all within easy walking distance. Only 1 problem....found out on checking out we should have had breakfast each morning!! Had been told on arrival it wasn't included in our deal. Check & double check!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore Harsh reviews, this place is decent!”
Reviews.Author: scott m
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews about this hotel we were very cautious of staying. On arrival late on a Sunday we were greeted by a very helpful man at reception who informed us of the numerous tourist attractions around the city. The hotel was clean with very friendly hotel maids who kept our room to an impressive cleaning standard throughout our stay. The breakfast was very good quality with a range of cold meats, pastries and cooked food available. The area of the hotel is not the best although locals all seemed friendly enough. We find some reviews harsh on the place and would recommend the Trpy Apolo to anyone looking for a good value and clean accomadation.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in October 2011. Our room was on the second floor facing the side street (the street with the large chimneys). It was very noisy. Street noises and loud people outside all night. Neighborhood is a little run down. Room was small but adequate since we spent very little time in there. The location of the hotel is good for all the major attractions and having the Metro on the next corner is great. Staff were helpful and had no problems speaking English with them. Also, we arrived before 8am and were able to check in early with no problem. Breakfast was included in the price and was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.. Great position and superb staff and lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SimeyBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2011 and you could not be anything else but impressed with it's location... near the harbour and 20 minute dander to the magic fountain with it's amazing nightly light show. The staff spoke grand English and were very helpful and the breakfast was a hot and cold buffet... Lovely and set you up til lunchtime... We stocked up on the lovely chocolate muffins and croissants! I would recommend the Michael Collins pub for it's lovely lunches and night entertainment and the hop on hop off bus brings you to everything you need to see in this class city...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money.”
Reviews.Author: sylik_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed mostly in 3 star hotels across our Europe Holiday, however for the same price we got this 4 star hotel in Barcelona and it was easily the best hotel of our journey. Fantastic Value for money. Pros: Very helpful and welcoming staff. We were given the option of a room with a view ( and more noise ) or a quieter room but no view. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The air conditioner worked very well, the bathroom was great (shower and bathtub combined). The buffet breakfast had the biggest selection we have come across and was delicious. The location was great as there is a train station subway entrance right outside the hotel and a supermarket 5 minutes walk away. Everyone spoke english as well as other languages. Cons: None. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and if we are lucky enough to go back to Barcelona we wouldn't look for another hotel. The hotel was fantastic and considering the price was that of the 3 star hotels, makes this hotels value even better.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: julia l
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay for 5 nights.staff helpful& pleasant.room spacious & peacefulvery clean & beds comfortable.breakfast excellent.great location We recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Harrold30
Reviews.Content: Very good value for moeny. Excellent service. Wre ahd booked a standard room but were upgraded without asking on arrival. Breakfast buffet very good value, great choice, good quality for only 11 euros. would recommend it without any reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: juliejeffreys304
Reviews.Content: Trpy Apolo hotel is in a great location for walking to Les Ramblas, and the Habour, The Beach is a little further but a pleasant walk and fantasic. We got a taxi from the airport - that cost 20/27euros We bought football tickets from spainticketbureu, they were very helpfull and no problems,(no need to by expensive tickets as all seat have a good view) we collected our tickets from their ticket office, that is based at the top end of Les Ramblas, on the left. They do also provide coach transport but we got a taxi, which only cost 12Euro. The Habour has great resturants and clothes shop and fantastic veiws. We done the open top bus City tour, well worth doing for 23euros, (booked at the hotel). The Metro, is right outside the hotel, we went to Gaudi Park, (for 5 people our train journey cost us 8euros 75....yes i know OMG that was so cheap...and that was return. Staff very helpfull and spoke good English No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, amazing breakfast, run down hotel!”
Reviews.Author: likeportraitsonwalls
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in August 2011, when we arrived we were welcomed by friendley staff. On route to our room the smell of stale cigarettes was quite apparent, our room didn't smell though. The room itself was a little dated and could do with a paint as there was a few marks and scrapes on the walls. The bathroom was ok, not the nicest, with the shower over a 3ft bath. The hotel is very clean but just needs some TLC. We stayed bed and breakfast, the breakfast was amazing you get seated by the staff and offered coffee at the table, then you go and help yourself to the buffet. The buffet includes full english, pastries, meats, cheeses, breads,fruit and juices. It was wonderful and set you up for the day. The hotel is a 5/10min from La Rambla, the metro stop is right outside the hotel so very easy to get places. If you want a budget stay in a 4* go here. But there are better hotels out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Sammy_3007
Reviews.Content: Good, clean hotel very close to the marina and Ramblas, right by a metro station. The room was pleasant and comfortable, bathroom a little bit tired but clean. I would rate it at 3* though. Breakfast was quite pricey so we didn't eat at the hotel. Service - not overally friendly, just average. If you're in Barcelona to explore the city (we did it for a week) and come back to the hotel just to sleep - the Tryp Apolo is perfect. For a romantic stay - try to find something a bit more luxurious :)

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: monikakw_11
Reviews.Content: Recommended I was staying in the hotel with my friend in August. The hotel is located 5 min walking distance from the main La Ramblas. It’s also situated 17 min walking distance from Placa Catalunya were you can catch a bus straight to the airport. The rooms are quite specious and clean. Towels are changed on daily basis. There’s air-conditioning and mini bar/fridge in the room. Our room was facing the street and had a balcony so we could watch the night life and even see Sagrada Familia from the distance. There’s an underground station right outside the hotel. You can also catch a bus no 24 if you’d like to go for a day trip to explore Guell park. The breakfast room is big and you can choose to have your breakfast outside in a garden if you’d like. As it was too hot for us we decided to stay inside in the nice and cool breakfast room. The choice of food available wasn’t disappointing .All nice, lovely and fresh. The reception staff very efficient and helpful. We wanted to see a real Flamenco show and they were happy to make a reservation for us. If you’re planning to see a traditional flamenco performance right in the centre of Barcelona I’d highly recommend Cordobes place. You want be disappointed!!! What else? There was nothing really that I could complain about in connection with the hotel. And the price is good too so I’d certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: sophie2483
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel cheap with our flight through Easyjet. It is perfectly pleasant, wouldnt say 4 star as such but we had no probs. Right by a Metro station which was convenient. The only downside was at night when the walk to the main Ramblas area was through a bit of a dodgy area with shifty looking people and prostitutes. Easy to get a taxi/metro to avoid this, but personally I prefer to be able to walk out of the hotel and wander round the area whatever time of day or night it is. We didnt have breakfast - but Dino Pan across the road was lovely for brekkie - and very cheap. It doesnt look much from the outside and they only speak Spanish but the sandwiches, coffee and cakes are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alysb
Reviews.Content: Returning again to the Apolo after 2 years...for a before and after Costa Cruise vacation. First 2 days....first floor room....very clean. We asked for a front room....and on Saturday night the people "come out" in the early AM til approximately 6 AM...to continue to 'party!'...until the sun rises. After our cruise we were on the 5th floor....superior room with ceiling to floor windows view a great view...also in the front, but very quiet. It was also a Monday night. The buffet breakfast is very good....lots of selections. The hotel is often the overnight base for the USAirways crew. 4 public computers for guests to use....can buy a card. I found it just as easy to use coins...1 Euro for 7 minutes. Desk reception - very friendly....and a special shout out to Miguel. There are always taxis available at any hour....but easy walking distance to La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeL2011
Reviews.Content: We arrived on our first day in which we were not seen to until 30minutes at the desk. The desk was overcrowded and the reception checking in were to busy talking to each other rather than serving. This hotel was overbooked and there was not sufficient staff to handle the task in matter. The room was standard with a bonus of added live creepy crawly in our bathroom. Generally the staff were rude and not helpful at all. We paid for our breakfast and during our stay we did not get to eat one breakfast, due to the fact that the queue was so long that it was a waste of time. The only plus point to this hotel is that it is situated in a very convenient place right next to the la ramblas and port vello. I would not recommend anyone who wants good service to stay here.
