This is definitely not a four star hotel maybe back in the past when there where no competitors. This is more like a 2 1/2 star hotel and good luck with the noisy hall way as the doors generally do not keep out the noise. I hope you have read this and taken it on board. Hope you have a nice holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Square1922
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, clean hotel in a brilliant location, perfect for sightseeing and access to the metro! We had a family room, which was 2 rooms with a dividing door. Loads of space, 2 TV's in the rooms, fridge (we stored our own drinks!) and a clean bathroom. I found all the staff, from reception to housekeeping, to be very helpful and happy to offer advice. The location on Av.Paral.lel is excellent, with a Metro station right outside! There is also the funicular railway from this metro station, which takes you up to Montjuic, with the Olympic Stadium, cable cars to the castle and some wonderful gardens and parks! All of the main tourist areas are within very easy reach from this location, using the metro. In addition, the hotel is only 10 minutes walk (maximum!) from Las Ramblas and from Port Vell. There are plenty of mini-supermarkets around, to get drinks and snacks, and lots of tapas bars and places for breakfast, lunch and dinner!! Try the smaller bakeries and cafes - brilliant service and excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor desk service”
Reviews.Author: arjwiz
Reviews.Content: First, the good. The hotel is located 5 minutes from La Ramblas. The metro stop is right outside the door. The rooms are good. We got a good corner room with a view to about 5 streets. They helped us with additional toileteries. The bad. The desk service is really poor. All of them act as if they are doing a favour by serving us. It is unpleasant walking up to them to checkin or checkout. One of them had me follow him towards the luggage storage compartment while I carried all my luggage myself, then he made me wait there while he chatted with another clerk. When I asked what was happening, he told me to wait a moment. After a while, I asked again, and he rudely told me to wait, after which he proceeded to walk off, not to be seen again. The other clerk then helped me load my luggage, but gesticulated frantically while doing so, indicating that my bags were heavy (they were about 10 kilos only). He kept grunting ferociously, trying to make me feel like he's doing a huge favour. After which, he held his hand out for a tip. No way did he deserve one. Very poor desk service.

Reviews.Title: “Highly don't recommend a stay at this place in U.S standards it would be a 1 star if even that !!!!!!"”
Reviews.Author: USA1963
Reviews.Content: Linens were frayed, it wouldn't matter what floor you were on you would hear sirens all nite the police station is right down the street, As for the complimentary breakfast left alot to be desired and if you have to have a breakfast to go ditto the yogurt was spoiled in it and the apple was rotten. There was Graffitti on the mirror housekeeping missed , also alot of mold, and cracked tiles. There standards don't meet ours .

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: lara s
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel with casino, and restaurants. Nice size room, very clean, and awkward shower head. WIFI 17 EUROS A DAY! crazy, not convenient since Barcelona does not have a lot of wifi. Good Location - ish. 5 min. walk to Las Ramblas and Barri Gotic area (popular, old citi with lots of bars and sights). You have to do a kinda shady walk at night, as 2 girls traveling alone we didn't feel super safe on the walk back to the hotel. Once you get to the hotel you are in a safe populated big area, but the walk in between is a little seedy at night. Close to public transportation. Friendly service. Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in a great location close enough to the tourist area but also close to a residential area where plenty of tapas bar”
Reviews.Author: Rhyd1
Reviews.Content: We found all hotel staff to be polite and helpful. We were upgraded to a superior room which had plenty of room, despite the running machine in the corner! The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice. There is a metro station outside the hotel making transfer to the airport very easy. The Ramblas and port are a ten minute walk away. Be sure to explore the area behind the hotel to discover the many local bars and tapas restaurants. Good quality food can be found at much cheaper prices than in the tourist areas. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Top quality in every aspect!”
Reviews.Author: Neil G
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be everything we expected and alot more,it was exceptionally clean, the room was rated as basic but lacked nothing and was infact very spacious, house keeping kept it spotless everyday. We could not have asked more of the receptionists either, almost everyday we went down for information and each time they out did themselves by providing alot more. Unfortunately the quickest walking route to Ramblas takes you through a not so pleasant road at night, this did not really get in the way of our enjoyment although in looking to avoid this road you could always catch the metro before midnight or take a short taxi ride which should not be too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Keith234
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again. Here are a few things I experienced: 1) When I booked online it stated check-in time was at 14:00. When we got there the sign said check-in time was at 15:00. However they still couldn't check us in until 16:00. 2) The front desk staff (all men) were very unhelpful. When we asked them for directions or any other simple question that you would typically ask them for, their response was always very vague or they just couldn't be bothered. 3) I cut myself on a door handle in my hotel room. When I went down to the front desk to ask for a plaster (adhesive bandage), the man at the front desk didn't seem concerned and couldn't be bothered to look for anything. I find it hard to believe that a hotel doesn't have a first aid kit. 4) During check-out the man at the front desk didn't even ask the typical questions (such as 'how was your stay?'...etc.). He just kept looking at the other people waiting to check out with a look on his face hoping he didn't have to wait on all of them. Save your money - there are other hotels in the area at a similar price with much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Lovely breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Ernierich
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Tryp Apolo pre-cruise in July 2011. We thought the hotel was generally ok, not fabulous but not rubbish either. The hotel has what I consider quite a late check-in time of 3:00pm. We arrived around midday, left the bags and went touring around the city until our room was ready (the centre is very close to the hotel. Just past a slightly seedy area). Unfortunately, even at three our room was still not available. We were eventually allowed to enter our room at around 3:30pm. We were told that the family rooms in the Tryp are so big that it takes a cleaner over an hour to finish the room. This must be an industry record! The whole 2nd floor of the hotel had a terrible stench of stale cigarettes which, thankfully, did not continue into the room. The room was well decorated and at first sight seemed quite nice with no sign of the worn carpets or cracked tiles mentioned in other reviews. It really can't have taken an hour to clean because it's not that muh bigger than a standard room. We noticed that the cot we'd requested hadn't been placed in the room but that was quickly remidied with a call to recepetion (we tried housekeeping at first but the language barrier proved too great) During the evening some cracks did begin to appear in the furnisings; The door handle fell off the toilet door and a skirting board fell off but it wasn't really enough to put us off the room/hotel. The hotel offers a fabulous breakfast. Plenty of choice, plenty of room for all the guests and helpful staff. It's worth having the breakfast if you stay here. Chek out the next day was a bit of a pain with the reception staff not being able to cope with the numbers trying to check out. I thought the reception staff were fairly surly, but my wife reckons that's just me! We stayed in the Hispanos Siete apartments post-cruise paying about £20 extra per night which offered a far superior experience to the Tryp. If I were to go to Barcelona again I pobably woudn't stay at the Tryp Apolo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent breakfast, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: louise1981000
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, well worth it's 4* rating. Breakfast was fantastic, really set you up for the day; lots of choice. The rooms were comfortable and clean, ours faced out on to the street which was quite noisy with the window open but with the window closed and air con on you could barely hear it. The reception staff were very helpful, and offered advice on where to go and what to do. They were also concerned re our safety and were always reminding us to keep our bags etc safe! Will definitely be returning-soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: lem2305
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fantastic over all, for a 4 star hotel: Breakfast - plenty of choice, full continental breakfast incl cereals, toast, cakes, muffins, biscuits, meats, eggs, fruit, cheese, tea, coffee, juice etc Rooms were quiet with fab air con. We had problems with our toilets and managed to get it fixed within the hour. Requested extra pillows and they were provided before we went to bed. Lady and Gentlemen at reception were extremely helpful and understanding. Tended to our needs and we even managed to book a show and waterpark through them. Location: Perfect! Not on the hussle and bussle of the las ramblas, however only a 10 minute walk to this street. Right next to the Parallel metro station - extremely easy to use with wheelchair access. Lots of little shops near by if you need to buy water. To/From Airport: In a taxi should cost no more than 20 euros (if that!) however please be aware we got charged an extra 7 euros for the costs of going to an aiport. Would return to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Tickle21
Reviews.Content: Lovely weekend away, this hotel is in an excellent location. The staff on the reception were friendly but staff in the restaurants were a bit rude and crashed plates and banged chairs. The breakfast was good with lots of choice, although it could have been warmer. We had been advised to stay at the back of the hotel as the front rooms are very noisy due to noise on the main road. The room was basic but fine, the view was a roof... If you dont plan on spending much time in your room this is ideal. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good value for money (nice breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl85
Reviews.Content: I am 26 and went to Barcelona with my mum, it was the first time for both of us. The Tryp Apolo hotel was a fantastic deal with Lastminute.com - we paid £195 each for a room only deal for Easyjet flights and two nights at the hotel. This also included a special offer where breakfast was included (usually 10 Euros for an all you can eat buffet). The hotel is four star, very clean and tidy, friendly staff and nice rooms. The breakfast was the only meal we ate there. It consisted of a buffet of both typical Spanish cuisine (chorizo, cold meats), lots of fresh fruit plus everything for both a continental and a full English breakfast (toast/bread, bacon, two types of egg, pastries, tomatoes, beans etc.). Something for even the fussiest of diners. The drinks were not as good: the coffee smelled like instant and there was only English Breakfast tea available. Orange juice was also offered. We had breakfast both days because it was included in our price but 10 Euros is quite expensive for breakfast (almost £9) when you could go into the city and find something in a café on La Rambla or in Barri Gothic. We stayed in a twin room, our view was over the courtyard which was pleasant. The room contained a fridge and a mini bar. The bathroom was very nice, a powerful shower, a hairdryer and complimentary toiletries. The hotel has a café if you want a cup of tea/coffee after a day of sightseeing which is next door to the hotel. We found this slightly dated and akin to an American diner but the staff were friendly and you could add the drinks to your tab. The hotel also has a bar on the reception floor. Overall, the location was excellent, only a few steps from the Paral-lel Metro station taking you straight to La Sagrada Familia and other sights. It is just 10 minute walk to the harbour area and a short bus ride to the beach. Tryp Apolo is a very nice hotel and fantastic value for the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: hotscotmom
Reviews.Content: Good standard hotel, room was adequate and well appointed. Internet available on mezzanine floor. Breakfast was outstanding and set us up for the day ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure but not a privilege”
Reviews.Author: Savannah84
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and clean, bit of noise as it looked over the busy street, close to La Rambla (touristy street with restaurants and shops) twenty minute walk from the beach, breakfast was lovely (probably the best bit) with cheapish internet. Only problems we had were one of the concierges who clearly didnt know which places we asked him about, but instead of admitting this sent us on wild goose chases into residential areas or tried to recommend eating places that were greasy and expensive. We also tried to book a bus transfer through the hotel to pick us up from the airport but the hotel claimed (even though we used their email) they could not remember any such booking and didnt solve the problem satisfactorily. For this kind of price the reception service should have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great City break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrDigzz62
Reviews.Content: Really well located hotel a few hundred yards from the Ramblas. Helpful staff and excellent english speakers. Rooms were nice although the bathrooms could do with a makeover. Lots of activity outside the hotel in local bars and restaurants but noise wasn't a problem. Breakfast was outstanding and a great way to stock up on calories before a busy day of sightseeing. Metro station was right outside the hotel with only a few stops to the Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitley stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: leah52
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Tryp Apolo for 5 nights from the 7th of July with my boyfriend, and from reading previous reviews was worried about the area and the hotel, but it was really really nice. we had a front facing room on the 3rd floor, looking out to the street of Barcelona and it was fine. We wasn't woken up once by the sound outside and got off the sleep fine every night. The room was lovely, very spacious and clean with the air con making the room lovely and cool. It was much nicer than i thought it would be. The hotel staff were amazing friendly and very helpful with their english being near enough perfect. The breakfast was nice and had a variety of different foods. Also the location was brilliant with the metro just outside and walking distance to the beautiful harbour and la rambla. Our stay at this hotel was great and very enjoyable. I would definitley stay here again, and would reccomend it to anybody who wants a hotel near to la rambla and the port.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: mahllo
Reviews.Content: I travel to Barcelona on a regular basis for work and stay at the Tryp Apolo. The Staff is always so welcoming and helpful. I can always count on the fact, the Staff will do everything possible to make my stay a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax before/after sightseeing in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: KDT15
Reviews.Content: Great location with Para-lel metro stop outside the door and short walk to La Rambla and Palau Guell. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful: from tips on tours and what to see, to printing out our boarding passes for the flight home. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I've ever experienced: self-service combined with table service, delicious fresh fruit cups, lovely pastries, nice assortment of bread, scrambled & fried eggs, Spanish tortilla and pan y tomate, plus 2 Jura coffee machines for expresso and warm milk for lattes. They also have pcs in the mezzanine for use at €3 per half hour which was handy for checking email, online check in, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, good location away from the hustle and bustle!”
Reviews.Author: Purple9126
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Tryp Apolo for a week in late June 2011, and couldn't majorly fault our stay. We loved its location, and how it is literally next to the Paral.lel metro station, which was our main way to travel for sightseeing and also very cheap if you get a single ticket for 1.45 euros. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from La Rambla, where we ate most nights, which was great as we were away from the hustle and bustle but in easy walking distance. The street the hotel is on isn't the most appealing to the eye and doesnt look the safest, but not once did we feel threatened or scared. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel as we felt it was a little overpriced, but there are plenty of cafes and fruit stalls around on the street so we didnt feel we missed out. I felt that the cleanliness and quality of the hotel was excellent - our room was a modest size, but a decent sized bed and bathroom. The entrance hall we thought was nice and clean! Our shower was a little temperamental, and our window was broken - but once we notified receptoin a handyman came within 5 minutes to fix it straightaway - very efficient! A negative side i would add would be the hotel gym isnt worth going to if you are intending to visit it often. I went there for a shower after we had checked out and were waiting to travel to the airport, and it was right around the back of the hotel, and not a very safe looking street. The gym was very dark and alot of building work was going on, and overall it seemed quite grotty. But overall we were very pleased with the hotel and thought it was good value for money. Some recommendations for eating: there is a square just off La Rambla called Plaza Real which has alot of great restaurants which are all decently priced. We ate twice by the beach which was more expensive, but good quality good, and worth trying out. This was our first trip to Barcelona and we both loved it - eating out was a little more pricey than expected but we found the city so interesting and fun, would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “hotel o/k”
Reviews.Author: sfn_sjn
Reviews.Content: me & my wife stayed here from the 20 june for 3 nights & had no problem room was clean& nice we had no problem with noise but our room over looked the court yard and not the main road breakfast was good with a vast choise we loved the location about a 10 /15 min walk to the port area & the rambles. also thi was our first time in barcelona & we loved it our ages are 62&56 but we are young at heart and loved the night live. would stay at this hotel again. as far as the reception staff we only went to reception when checking in & when chcking out so can not make any comment about them

Reviews.Title: “Avoidable”
Reviews.Author: satyenthadani
Reviews.Content: There are several hotels around Las Ramblas... do yourself a favour and avoid this one. Staff: In the four nights that we stayed there, we had at least 3-4 cases of the front desk staff being curt, unfriendly and impolite. The staff answers your questions to the point, but they are not helpful. We arrived after the scheduled check-in time and had to wait for a single bed room. We were bluntly told that “your reservation for a single big bed is only a request!” There was no “We apologize for the delay” or any similar pleasantry one expects from the service industry. On check out, we asked if we could vacate at 2pm instead of noon and were told “You can leave your bags in the storage room we have.” She did not even add a polite “I’m sorry but that will not be possible”. I can understand that they are visibly overworked, but I cannot accept that as an excuse for their unwelcoming behaviour. Service: The Housekeeping did not have any moisturizer. We asked for a pair of scissors, and were told that “I don’t think we have.” IN A 4 STAR HOTEL ?!? Location: The hotel is well located, with Las Ramblas a 10 walk from the hotel. However, if you want to take the short cut, be prepared to encounter some extremely shady crowd on the way. And after dinner at night, I suggest you take the long route. Rooms: The rooms were small, as one expects from all hotels in the heart of Barcelona. The rooms were clean, but the hotel definitely needs a makeover/renovation. The fixtures, fittings and other accessories are visibly old and need to be changed. There was a lot of noise at 3:00 am with after party crowd shouting on the streets. I saw a few guests complaining about the noise. But I cannot attribute this as a flaw of the hotel. However, if anyone is a light sleeper and would be disturbed by the noisy banter in the middle of the night, I suggest you “request” a non street facing room .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: acrossthepondtravel
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Apolo was a good hotel located right across the street from the Paral-lel Metro Station (L3, green line) and only a 5-10 minute walk from Las Ramblas and the harbor. When we arrived at 4pm (after the check-in time), our room wasn't ready so we had to wait for awhile until it was cleaned - that is my only complaint. We booked a family room for 4 which ended up being perfect. The rooms were basic but nicely sized and the beds were comfortable. The receptionists were very helpful with city information and even helped us book tickets to the futbol stadium. We were able to leave our luggage in the luggage room for free all day after we had checked out (even though the luggage man wasn't very friendly). We did not have any issues with noise like other people have reviewed about. Pleasant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, noisy and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: olivierelena
Reviews.Content: For the first time i went to Barcelona. My friend and i were very excited untill we say our hotel . the entrance was old and not nice at all! we had a flight at 6.30 in the morning and we arrived at 9 in the hotel. normally you can check in at 12 h , in tryp apolo you can only check in at 15h. We were awake at 4h in the night and we couldn't go for more then six hours in our rooms. at 15h we were back in the hotel and we checked in. we had to take our suitcases by ourself. Because we are young, I don't mind but we saw that they didn't help older people either . we came in our room, the king size bed were two separate beds , the room was clean but very old. the shower always jumped very hot when you were standing under it. we slept horrible because of the noice outside, lots of people were standing on the streets and they were very loud. the next day we woke up at 9.45 so we were downstairs for our breakfast at 10h, the breakfast was untill 10.30h but we couldn't sit outside because they didn't want to clean the tables anymore after 10.15 . THe breakfast was ok but not for a four star hotel. at 10.30 h they shut down the lights from the food. They wanted to assure that is was now time to leave. we wanted to take the tour bus and they were very friendly at the front desk, it was a man who helped us. he was very nice to us. the next day we had a table outside so that was good. we had accepted that the hotel wasn't what we excepted but then the next morning , we were early enough at the breakfast. we wanted to sit outside(it was 9.50h) the woman who cleans the tables said that we couldn't sit outside. Then we see to men in suits, sitting outside. we went to the front desk and they told us that it was the manager. the front desk, also a woman, called the woman from the breakfast. she told us that we were too late and that she couldn't clean all the tables by herself. you have to know that inside there wasn't any table clean for two persons and outside there was. The lady from the front desk and from the breakfast were talking to us like we were children and the next day we have to wake up earlier. For a four star hotel, this isn't the way how you treat your guests. we had enough from this hotel but we only had to stay one more day. the travel agency recommended this hotel but we had lots of regrets that we listened to them. Barcelona itself is very nice to see but the hotel was just horrible. the internet was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: drlooper
Reviews.Content: While the hotel provided everything it advertised, the pictures are much too flattering. The front desk staff were to really only helpful people we came in contact with. The hotel was chosen based on location to the cruise ship piers and general price. We had ended a bus tour in Barcelona in another part of town and moved to this hotel to be within a reasonable taxi ride to embark our ship for a cruise of the Mediterranean.; The Pros: Front Desk Staff The Cons: Section of town not the most desirable or tourist friendly. The included breakfast was not worth the cost. The breakfast staff treated hotel guests as a bother. Food not readily replenished. The hotel is showing wear. The room was clean but well worn. The ultimate Con: The taxi line outside the hotel. While the hotel is not directly responsible they bear the burden of my frustration. The taxi driver went in the opposite direction of the pier when he left the hotel. By the time we circled the block and got back to the hotel the meter was already more than 3 euros. Then when we got to the pier he did something to the meter that jumped the price from 7 euros to 18 euros and told us it was a surcharge for going to the pier. Funny, friends of our who took a same from the same hotel to the same pier only a few minutes later paid only 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location whether you want to walk or take public transit”
Reviews.Author: Georgetrotter
Reviews.Content: This was one of the more reasonably priced hotels located within walking distance of La Ramblas and a few steps away from the subway. The exterior does not scream luxury but it is equipped with everything you need as well as a lovely rooftop breakfast/dining area. The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. They really take the time to answer questions and give recommendations. You will be reminded time and again to mind your belongings when stepping out but this is hardly unique to Barcelona, any seasoned traveller is always cautious. Try to get a room facing away from avenue Paralelo. It is a very busy street even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: MissA33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was clean, comfortable, quiet and spacious, all you could expect from a 4 star hotel, but at a bargain price! It was next to the metro station which was super convenient, but you could also walk to the Gothic Quarter in 10 or 15 minutes. I thought it might be a bit too out of the way, but is was actually quite a relief to leave the narrow, crowded streets of the Gothic Quarter and return to our hotel at night. The staff were lovely and helpful and I can't really fault this place. It obviously lacks Catalunian charm, but you can't have it all when you're on a budget! I would definitely recommend it if you can get a good deal on a room, and it's also probably great for families as they have adjoining family rooms etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotless hotel, good price.”
Reviews.Author: Chippytea
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is undoubtedly one of the best places to stay in central Barcelona. While the hotel is entirely devoid of character, what does that matter when you're in the centre of one of Europe's most beautiful cities? The rooms are spotlessly clean, the beds large and comfortable, the service slick and professional. Downstairs, the cafe bar is reasonably priced if you want a drink - but there's no need when you're within five minutes' walking distance of Las Ramblas and some of the best bars in Raval. Yes, it's a samey businessy-type hotel. But it's simple, done well, very reasonably priced and a perfect base from which to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Sleep with the noise”
Reviews.Author: Beaulie
Reviews.Content: Neither of the two rooms we booked had air conditioning - therefore in late May we had to have the window open. OK if the room is facing the rear of hotel, however, the front of the hotel is a different story. Loud, drunk people coming out of the Apolo Casino all night long make it impossible to get a goodnights sleep. This does not let up! It goes on till the morning. On other aspects, staff were nice enough and the rooms were ok size but the carpets and bathrooms were terrible for what claims to be a 4 star. I can only presume I was duped and it was a self awarded '4 asterix' maybe? Wifi was expensive, especially compared to the WiFi at the Tryp Hotel in Palma.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, ideal base for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Bournemouth17
Reviews.Content: Husband and I booked through Lastminute.com and after reading some of the reviews wondered what we had let ourselves in for! We arrived at the hotel early in the morning and where able to check in even though our room wasn't available, they stored our luggage in safe room it was free. The hotel is located in a great position about 10 mins walk to the Marina, and the same to Ramblas. It is also conveniently located for the Metro - 50 metres from hotel front door. Rooms where clean and comfortable; the breakfasts was like having a 3-course meal, great variety. If you're like us and spend your holidays out of the hotel, sight seeing, then this is a great place to come back to at end of the day to chill and recovered for the next day. There was only one downside: Barcelona winning the Champions League whilst we were there....the Spanish know how to celebrate until the early hours of the morning....but who can blame them! We would definitely recommend to friends and family (and anyone else going to Barcelona!)

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: IanBradley
Reviews.Content: We booked an accessible room through Expedia at this hotel. When we arrived the room had a bath and not the walk-in shower we had requested. The hotel deputy manager admitted that there may have been some confusion over what an accessible room was (in Spain accessible may mean something different). The deputy manager was excellent and although the Tryp Apolo did not have any rooms with a walk in shower he almost immediately found us a room in another Tryp Hotel. Unfortunately this hotel was a long way from the city centre. He then offered us another room in any other hotel nearby. Within 30 mins he had located a hotel only 2 mins walk from the Tryp Aplo and transferred all of our payments to them. Although we did not stay in the Tryp Apolo and it is clearly not suitable for disabled people, the support and service we received from them was excellent and we would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenmba3
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears to be popular but I would not recommend it for travellers looking for something above average. There was no help from the front desk. Only David was helpful to me. The location is good next to the metro but gets scary at night. There is even no free internet services and there is nothing to do in this hotel. No amenities at all. The king size bed was 2 twin beds pushed together.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - but room maintenance a bit below standard”
Reviews.Author: david-the-banker
Reviews.Content: I slept well, breakfast was good, the bed comfortable, service excellent, and the room fine. However there were a few bits of maintenenace that were a bit worrying - The fan motor was very noisy. It didn't matter because I didn't need airconditioning and slept with the window open. - I borrowed an ironing board and a steam iron. The heating control on the iron was missing and in its place were bare wires. I was told not to put my finger in the hole or put water in it. - the security catch on the window was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: MarnieBath
Reviews.Content: We booked via Lastminute.com. This was a good, affordable hotel. The room was clean, mattress very comfortable (a big plus), breakfast included (full range of options, but avoid cereal as it tastes like cardboard), no tea making facilities in our room (but it looks like the premier rooms do have). It is in a great location 8mins walk from the Las Ramblas. We were very satisfied and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but smoky-smelling room”
Reviews.Author: Salthawk
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it is not too far from the Barcelona Sants Railway Station. The staff was very polite and helpful. Our only complaint is that our room smelled like smoke. It was a non-smoking room as requested; however, it had obviously been a smoking room in years past. The drapes and upholstered chairs smelled of smoke. A positive was that we found a nice restaurant and grocery nearby. The neighborhood was decent and we felt safe walking around in the daytime. However, when in Barcelona, you need to keep your valuables close to you as there are thieves who like to take advantage of unwary tourists.

Reviews.Title: “good location, very noisy and no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: heroin1
Reviews.Content: Pros: Metro located right outside hotel ok price wise rooms clean free access to a gym round the corner which has a wide variety of equipment Cons: very noisy if you are facing onto the the main street. Lasted all night - party goers and then buses from 5am. The air conditioning was not working and we were told that it was still winter in barcelona (it was 23 degrees) and it would not be turned on until summer and to open a window (impossible because of the noise). need to walk down some poorer areas to get to las rambles - ok during the day but would not advise to walk it as a female alone after about 10/11pm definitely not a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Concierge and staff were not very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Daniela1013
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel which is very close to the metro but a bit far from many tourist attractions. The hotel concierge and staff were not very helpful in answering our questions and not very accommodating. When asked about the weather, we were not given an answer. When asked about where a particular restaurant was located, we were told to go elsewhere and we tried their recommendation and the food was AWFUL!! When asked about restaurants they kept telling us not to go and gave us recommendations to go elsewhere. They offered us very expensive group tours that were affiliated with the hotel. They never gave us a wake up call and we could've missed out flight back to the U.S. When asked why we weren't called, we were told that someone picked up, then hung up which was not the case because our room phone didn't even ring. Internet access is very expensive and the staff didn't research any tourist attraction information for us. The rooms were clean, had a security safe, mini-fridge. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom amenities were good except for the poor blowdryer. Our overall experience with this hotel was poor! I would not stay there again and not recommend others to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy service, busy casino and a so-so location didn't fit the bill”
Reviews.Author: Qlever
Reviews.Content: After a whirlwind stay in Madrid, my friend and I were thrilled to head toward Barcelona and a higher-rated hotel. Unfortunately, the Tryp Apolo didn't live up to its four-star rating during our stay. While the hotel is near a metro, the nearby restaurants and nightlife leave a lot to be desired - you'll be jumping on the train to find a good restaurant, shopping or nightlife. The annoying downstairs casino wasn't mentioned in the advertising we saw, though it attracted a noisy crowed each night directly below our window. The lack of free wifi was a huge pain, making our planning each day difficult. Worst of all, the staff at Tryp seemed determined to avoid answering even the most simple of questions. Each time we visited the front desk (a daily occurrence), we were in for a wait. No matter how simple our request or question (forecast, directions, etc.) we were met with unhelpful staff who were unable to provide assistance, and directed us to use the paid internet service or in-room phone to get more information. Upon checking in we were provided a small "tourist package" that contained recommendations for restaurants and tours that the staff pushed - HARD. When we called to request assistance making reservations at a highly-recommended restaurant, we were informed that it was "overrated and pricey," which was inconsistent with our experience at the establishment later that night. Instead, the staff once again pushed their "preferred" restaurant and refused to assist with our request. The final straw came when the requested wake-up call didn't come through and we barely made our flight home. The cab ride that the front staff suggested would cost 20 euro cost well over 30, and ensured that the hotel experience left a bad taste in our mouths. (Thank goodness Barcelona, the city, made up for the poor service.)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent all rounder...”
Reviews.Author: timfifield
Reviews.Content: Got back yesterday after a fantastic 5 day trip - hotel was very, very comfortable with easy access to Las Ramblas, the Port and old town. The Metro is literally outside and provides impecable access to all areas of the city however try to walk as much as you can as even walking the same streets keeps yielding architectural and cultural surprises. Hotel staff were friendly, efficient and English speaking. Breakfast was excellent - plenty of choice and some cheeky takeaway fruit and bread opportunities for lunch/snacks. The room was clean, well furnished and relaxing. Avoid Las Ramblas for eating - food quality is poor and VERY expensive. Get yourself into the old town for some amazing food options - loads of choice. Also head down to the port and walk along the front for some good inexpensive seafood and some spanish people watching. We chose a two day ticket on the Bus Turistic bus tour which gave us a real feel for the city and allowed us to choose the sites we'd like to go to. We loved Sagrada Familia and all the Gaudi stuff - some of his architecture just made me smile, what a guy! We also loved the stunning views of the city from Park Guell - nice adventure getting there too! All in all the key is to walk as much as you can, get you bearings with a bus tour and then use the Metro for quick hops around the city. Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: johnkavanagh88
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend in feb, we found the staff very friendly and the hotel very clean, 5 mins walk to la ramblas, nou camp and sagradia familia just a few metro stops away, we found barca to be grat value for eating out etc and would definitely stay there again if we go back, all in all a good stay at a very reasonably price

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at edge of downtown Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BettyBoop81791
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the value. It was at the fringe of downtown Barcelona so it was walking distance from everything, but not too close where you couldn't sleep at night for all the noise. The only bad thing I have to say is the restaurant that was attached that they directed us to wasn't very good. But there's tons of places to eat nearby so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - best present ever!”
Reviews.Author: MissChoulesy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Barcelona for my 21st birthday for 3 nights, and I absolutely loved it. The Tryp Apolo is clean, comfortable and in a good location for exploring the city, especially the marina, Las Ramblas and the Barri Gotic. We arrived at midday and managed to check in straight away, despite a sign on the reception desk saying we wouldn't be able to until 2pm. Contrary to what a lot of others have said, the staff were helpful and friendly - we even had a little bit of banter with the porter! Our room was on the 6th floor, with a balcony overlooking the Avenue Parallel with its 6 lanes of traffic! Noisy, but once you closed the door you could barely hear a thing, so sleeping was no problem. The bed's were very comfy and the bathroom clean and perfectly adequate. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty, so we made the most of it and filled our bellies! There was a Metro station just outside the hotel, which was very handy for getting around the city - cheap, quick and also very clean compared to the London Underground. I had a great time in Barcelona and fell in love with the city. I have to say my highlight was seeing Antoni Gaudi's Sagrada Familia, it was out of this world. You cannot go to Barcelona and not see this amazing building. Gaudi's influence is apparent all over the city, with several buildings evidently touched by his genius and of course, the Parc Guell. But I think my boyfriend would say his highlight was the Nou Camp, in the north of the city, which was also very impressive and well worth the visit! All in all, this hotel was perfect for the two nights we stayed there and was just what we needed - a comfortable base from which to explore this magnificent Spanish city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BTCardiff
Reviews.Content: We are a seasoned travellers and always expect the worse. Hotel: This hotel is faultless. The room was great, cleaned out early morning - 8/9am and the staff were friendly - they even gave us a packed breakfast on our 5am departure. Our room overlooked the main street. It's in a city location so you can't expect parks or mountains. It's fine. Breakfast is a very good buffet with a large choice of cooked food, cold meats and cheeses, fruits, drink, pasties and breads and an omelette station. Ours was included. Location: 10/15 minutes to the harbour leisure area and the start of La Rambla. Tapas bars and cafes just across the main road and a shortcut to La Rambla (Carrer Nou de la Rambla) with many interesting shops as an alternative walk one day. The hotel has a bar and "snack" bar attached which are reasonable. We didn't try the restaurant.. Getting there: Buses every few minutes right outside the airport terminal- 5euros. We needed Placa Espanya stop to get the metro for two stops. We missed our stop and got off at the University. We checked the map and walked - easily do-able with one case between us. Departing at 5.30am we got a cab from the rank outside - 27E. With four hours to kill before check in we left our bags, went to the harbour and took a harbour cruise (18E) for 90mins - great way to see the city from the near the shoreline. On the return I had a large beer for 3E on the boat which was great. Things to see; For us, the Cathedral (go inside), la Sagrada Familia - huge queues but worth just seeing it, la Boqueria food market displays are staggeringly beautiful, Gaudi's Casa Batlio (pay to go inside - it's worth it), La Pedrera and of course the street theatre in La Rambla night and day. We took the City Bus tour for 23E each but frankly it wasn't worth it - too quick to even take photographs. We were there at the same time as a previous reviewer and I simply don't recognise his poor experience. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “A sad,tired and uninspiring stay at a shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richie6664
Reviews.Content: I checked out the reveiws of this hotel prior to visiting and thought it would be ok. Our room had a veiw of a dark central shaft so we upgraded at 124 Euro to a larger room with veiw. It was noisy from the neighbours and traffic even though we were on the 6th floor. The bathroom was shabby,cracked tiles and a shower off the bath taps...lame. The fittings were poorly fitted and carpet dirty. Room was not cleaned until 5pm so no chance of a rest in your room. There was even a charge for the internet which kept crashing.Reception staff were unhelpful, there was never anyone serving at the bar and the gym was located in what can only be described as downtown Beruit. Dont bother staying here,you will be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location! cannot fault it”
Reviews.Author: ohwhatsoccuring71
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. The metro stop was outside the entrance to the hotel! the port was just a short walk and the ramblas was about 15-20 minute walk. the rooms were comfortable, spacious and quiet. We added on breakfast to our stay for an extra 10euros a night each. Breakfast was good, filled us up till dinner time! Could not fault the hotel at all. I got the hotel through lastminute.com top secret hotels. I was pretty apprehensive about booking this way as the name was not revealed until i had paid. it described the hotel as "Exceptional location in Barcelona. Personalised service together with an exceptional location very near to Las Ramblas and only 10km from the airport. Metro and bus connections next to the hotel. The hotel offers spacious and comfortable rooms and a great selection from its breakfast buffet, lobby bar, restaurant and snack bar (with varied menu). Also, there is a fitness centre near to the hotel that is free to its clients."

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Rhooseboy
Reviews.Content: A bit suspicious about booking due to the reviews but I was more than happy with the hotel. The room was clean and big and we did not experience any problems. The showers was great. We got a very good deal for 50 Euro a night. Breakfast was an additional 10 Euros but there was a good selection. As mentioned the hotel is not in the nicest place of town however never felt this being an issue. The metro is right outside the hotel so access to anywhere is easy. The rablas took about 10 minutes to walk to. A taxi from the airport cost 25 Euro's. When I go back to Barcelona I would stop here again, just depends on deals available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scooter_014
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Apolo in Jan 2011. This hotel is excellent, the rooms were huge and the beds were very comfortable. There was a nightclub outside below my window, but the rooms are very quiet and I had no problem sleeping. The breakfast offers a large selection of hot and cold plates. The hotel rooms have LCD TVs with 50+ channels, including several HD channels. My negatives are that the hotel is not is a great area, it is somewhat seedy. However, the hotel's front door is literally a 2 minute walk from the very safe subway station which can carry you in minutes to anywhere in the city. Also, the hotel offers internet access, but the prices are very high. I would recommend using an internet cafe on La Rambla, which charge a much lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: palmer_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the 6th january and i honestly could not fault the hotel at all. Staff were great, really helpful. The rooms certainly seemed a good size! Can not understand why you would want or need a bigger room. Rooms were clean and fully equipped. Our room included balcony looking out over the main street, yes it could be noisy at times but barcelona is a noisy city! If you stay in a city you have to expect a bit of noise surely.. Location was great, 5 minute walk to the bottom of la rambla, metro station right outside the door and taxis available at all times. It might not be the nicest of areas but we certainly did not have any problems walking back at night, although we did always stick to the main roads after reading previous reviews about side streets. Overall i felt the hotel was great value for money and if i was to go back to barcelona i would have no problems staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: david-the-banker
Reviews.Content: Many things are really good about this hotel. Its convenient for the waterfront and the Maritime Museum. The breakfasts were good and the lounge area on the mezzanine floor was good for informal meetings with good wifi connectivity. I had asked for a quiet room and got one overlooking the central space. Below the central space is the Apolo theatre (which was running a production of the rock musical "Hair") I could barely hear it. It isn't perhaps as new or as glitzy as some from the outside but inside it was fine. The service was great and we slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huuhkaja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more three stars, accomodating many cruise travellers. Apolo needs refurbishing. I stayed both premium room in April and standard room in October for one person. Cons: - Clumsy room door even for premium room, light and some noise comes under it. - Wifi extra fee, included for premium. - small minibar and they charged me for waters I didn't use as minibar wasn't filled when I checked in. - shower bath not comfortable - hectic reception - breakfast with limited options, mostly noisy as hotel was full. - rude staff both timed of my stay Pros: + clean bedlinens, bed comfort ok + location, if you don't mind traffic on Paral lel street. + if you get an offer, then this is one choice, but might be difficult to get as for ship travellers. I wouldn't pay over 100€ rate for standard room. Pros

Reviews.Title: “Most of the reviews on this hotel are rubbish- the hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: Amyeeee
Reviews.Content: Before going to Barcelona for 4 days at the end of November 2010, the reviews I'd read had made me very nervous about what to expect. But my view now is that they were written by complete snobs! The hotel is in a great location, right next to Parallel metro station (which is very easy to get to from the airport- take a Renfe train 3 stops and get the green metro line down to Parrallel). Everyone speaks excellent english, and were very helpful. We were offered a room facing the back of the hotel, so we wouldn't have the noise off the street. The room is very clean, and despite some claims that the rooms were small, I found it to be no smaller than your usual hotel rooms, and if it were any bigger there would be a lot of wasted space! As for the area, I'm not sure if it was because we came at a colder time of year (12C mostly), but I didn't find it seedy. Sure it wasn't the nicest area, but as long as your not stupid and walk through dark streets on your own with your phone out, you'll be fine. One thing I would recommend to people going to Barcelona soon is not to bye the Barcelona card! My 4 days pass cost 37 euros, but I could have got a 4 day travel card for 22 euros. The extra 15 euros seems to have been for the guide and map it includes, which was rubbish! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everywhere, but...”
Reviews.Author: iiipek
Reviews.Content: The service is poor and there was always a line at breakfast. Workers are not very friendly. The location is good (there's a Metro stop right in front of it and you can just walk to La Rambla), however, I agree with comments about the area being a bit seedy. We ended up with this hotel because were traveling with a group but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was the best part of the stay”
Reviews.Author: norms_mom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tryp Apolo 3 nights. It isn't exactly in a seedy area but rather that you have to walk through one to get to the Ramblas. Located right at a Metro stop and the place to catch the funicular. Walking distance to the waterfront and to the Ramblas. The breakfast room was sunny and bright with good selections. There was always a guard in the lobby. Internet for a fee with 6 computers available for guests. Room was OK but loud at times. There must be better places but this one was OK.

Reviews.Title: “a good central location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: clarebmurphy
Reviews.Content: a clean tidy hotel - we booked on last min .com and had a very good deal, therefore were happy with what we got for the money we paid. I wouldn't have been as happy if i had paid full price. however the hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful - the location is central and not far from the rambles. the breakfast is good - lots to choose from

Reviews.Title: “Crap all round”
Reviews.Author: jax_1968
Reviews.Content: A big, anonymous, poor quality hotel that feels a bit like a rest home. Hordes of group package tourists from America.....Booked at the last minute and it cost alot...we couldn't find anything else unfortunately. This is not a four star hotel...cracked seal around the bath,...marked walls. Beds were okay, but everything just a little tired. Clean though. Stayed at heaps of places on this holiday and really, value for moneywise it's crap...Don't stay there. I am not one of these fussy, hard to please people and stayed in a range of quality hotels on this trip around europe. Oh and really noisy....especially if you have a room on the side street. There is a casino underneath....

Reviews.Title: “Good locatiion, iffy service”
Reviews.Author: bertnI
Reviews.Content: Good location near La Rambla area with many restaurants, cafes, bars nearby. Don't get talked into the breakfast buffet deal unless you definitely don't have time to go out. There are many places within ten minutes that are as cheap or cheaper. Bar service is rediculously expensive, best to check prices before ordering. Again, there are many places close by. Front desk staff can border on rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent - awesome breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: dmather47
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel close enough to the action - within walking distance. Helpful staff. We loved the breakfast buffet in the morning. Recommended by friends - great stay.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory experience”
Reviews.Author: xxx026
Reviews.Content: the experience of my stay at the hotel was satisfactory. Sometimes there were problems at the reception but overall it was a nice exoerience to stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and suprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: Kocickasmom
Reviews.Content: My mom and I spent one night here after our cruise as we wanted to do some sightseeing before returning home. (They selected the hotel). Our room was clean and had no tobacco smell. We were located in the front, right above the entrance. The street outside was busy all the time, but we didn't hear any traffic sounds. We heard people getting off the elevator right outside our door, but that was muted and infrequent. As soon as we checked in we asked about getting a tour to Montserrat and they were able to book this and we were on the tourbus within an hour. We didn't have the opportunity to eat breakfast there, as the cruise line sent a taxi at 7am to take us to the airport. We were able to use their computer room to print our boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: nancyb926
Reviews.Content: Although very close walking distance to many of Barcelona's attractions, the hotel was located in a rather seedy part of town. Never feeling wholly safe, even when with others, I think there are other hotels that I ould consider if not here with a tour group. Our twin bedded room was a good size, clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffert offered more variety than expected and food quality was good. Staff was very helpful and spoke English well. Paid internet was not working during our 4 day stay, so I cannot comment on cost.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome breakfast & Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: alhambramd
Reviews.Content: It was an ok hotel, it wasn't anything luxurious, but then again were only using the place to sleep in. It had all the basics-- bed was ok, bathrooms were clean, reception desk was always helpful. The breakfast was such a great deal, for around 10 per person, they served an extensive continental breakfast, with 3 kinds of eggs, selection of cold cuts/ cured meats, assorted breads and pastries, salads. It's located right on the Metro stop for Paral-el along the green line, which made it a really convenient place for all our sightseeing. Would stay there again because of the great breakfast and the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Bad first impression”
Reviews.Author: nexvilentus
Reviews.Content: We (mum, daughter, 2 x friends and I) arrived at 21:30 and was greeted at reception by someone who seemed distracted. We booked in and I produced our free breakfast vouchers, which was an offer when booking through Expedia, only to be told they only meant 1 free breakfast each per stay to which I argued against and said I'd call Expedia the next day to get some clarification. He did suggest I book a 'special deal' with him and only pay 10 euro for breakfast! We where all on the first floor which smelt smokey as soon as we left the lift, lots of pictures and prints on the walls but carpet a little tired looking.Our rooms where on each side of the building so we all experienced different levels of noise, but our room seemed the loudest as people would sit by a water feature outside from very late on and drink till dawn! Mebbes time to upgrade double glazing The following day I spoke to a different receptionist about the free breakfast offer and without making any fuss said he would inform the dining room that breakfast would be free for our entire stay. Result! The breakfast provided a good choice and plenty of it. Rooms had cracked tiling, no loo brush, but lots of freebies and the shower and handwash was lovely, unlimited supply of hotwater The waiter in the bar late on a night worked between the hotel and cafe, so you either had to wait for him to comeback or go looking for him. OK location ~ prepare for lots of walking, you'll see so much ,and there are really resonable eateries nearby with good choice. Had a mini bar bill when checking out, but none of us had anything at all. Beware when walking to the Ramblas of pick pockets, they even operate in shops and time spent in the police station can be a couple of hours depending when translators are available!!

Reviews.Title: “perhaps 4 star a decade ago, certainly not anymore! Thouroughly underwhelmed by this one.”
Reviews.Author: Niv14
Reviews.Content: The only real positive is that as a guest of the hotel you have free access to what is a fairly decent gym round the corner, with all the machines and weights you could need. However, a few weeks after our stay, I still feel strongly enough to write my first ever hotel review! Now for the hotel. The location of this place really isn't brilliant but, it's right next to the metro stop Para'lel and is a short walk to las Ramblas. However, it’s pretty much in a red-light area so more than likely, you will encounter some ladies of the night on your way to the more popular areas of Barcelona if you don't pay attention to your route in the evening time. Although I must say didn't feel at all unsafe at any point, as I went out a for a late snack on my own one night. The hotel is deemed 4 stars but I think that decision was made quite a while ago! The hotel is in serious need of renovation. It has all the signs of former glory, but these signs, don't necessarily fit with the here and now. Its a little stuck in a time warp, but unfortunately picked one of the worst decades decor-wise to get stuck in! The reception area is large but not particularly welcoming with random displays and oddly placed furniture. I got chased by an over zealous security guard clearly with nothing better to do that inspect guests with heavy suitcases wanting to use the bathroom, to make sure they were indeed guests of the hotel! Lifts are a little scary and dimly lit. We took the stairs one day to avoid the rickety lifts only to find the stair wells were being used as a dumping ground for house-keeping supplies and extra bedroom furniture. Unfortunately, smoking laws mean that unless you smoke yourself and don't mind the smell, your room will most likely have the faint odour of stale cigarettes. So much so that we had to ask to change rooms. You actually have to request a non smoking-room, and even then, the faint smell lingers. Had to go to reception in person as no-one answered the phone. The bathroom was cleanish, but again with dated fixtures and fittings; free toiletries were a poor substitute. Also the carpets in the room and corridors were stained and there was rubbish from previous guests in the corners of our room and under the bed. Our double bed was in fact two pushed together, that's how we found all the rubbish as our beds moved during the night! Breakfast was extortionately priced, especially as there are much cheaper cafes and bars not far away. The Hesperia hotel was across the road and, having used the hotel before, we wished we were there, even though it had a lower star rating. On the whole not impressed with this hotel, it's worth searching for a good 3 star like the Hesperia rather than be let-down by this over priced four star. Even if the star rating was lowered I'm not sure it would be sufficient, the whole place left us feeling grubby and cheated. Our deal was done through Lastminute.com who clearly also don't veto their lists of hotels. To be honest coming from a clean budget hotel culture that we have in the UK I felt quite hard done by - price to quality ratio was quite low, especially in view of the star rating. Best to avoid if you can.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, bad neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Abianco
Reviews.Content: for 66 € per night accommodation only for 2 people, i think we got a great deal. however, the hotel should renovate at least its bathroom towels... great connections to park guell (bus stop 100 mt on the right), public beaches and underground. if you have prejudices, think about it: it's an immigrant area, can't say it's unsafe, but walking back at 10 pm from las ramblas was quite an experience with hookers and pimps... the hotel is chosen by a lot of airlines for their crews, so i don't think it is BAD, after all. in the bathrooms shaving kits and toothcare kits: not very common for basic rooms. minibar:any drink 2 €, any snack 1.50 €. Breakfast expensive, but if you just croos the road you'll find Dino Pan, inexpensive traditional continental breakfast: cappuccino and croissant just 1.70, cappuccino and two tostadas with butter and jam just 2.10.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: clareandjoey
Reviews.Content: Whilst all experiences of any hotel are likely to be individual, the negative reviews of this hotel have surprised me. We are just back from 4 nights at the Tryp Apolo, and found it to be a very comfortable and pleasant hotel. Having read some negative reviews before leaving, I was a bit worried, but had got a great deal on the hotel, and was very happy with it once we got there. We had a room on the 5th floor, and experienced no problems at all with noise from the traffic or anything else. The beds were extremely comfortable, and we slept great every night (probably aided by long days spent sightseeing). We didn’t eat at the hotel, but surely the point of being in Barcelona is to be out there experiencing it! The hotel’s location is also excellent if you are there for sightseeing. There is a metro station (Paral-lel) right outside the hotel, from which you can get to pretty much anywhere in a matter of minutes (Las Ramblas is 1 stop away). However we mostly walked; Las Ramblas is maybe 5 or 10 minutes down the road opposite. The Columbus monument is about 5/10 minutes straight down Paral-Lel. You can even walk to the Magic Fountains which is about a 20/30 minutes walk straight up Paral-Lel (the area at the top of Paral-Lel is breathtaking with the view up to the Museum). I have no doubt that there are nicer and better hotels in Barcelona than the Tryp (the Eixample district seemed to be the best area), but I also doubt you could get them for the rates of the Tryp. The hotel is very nice, and was a great base for an absolutely superb trip in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star at all in any stretch of the imagination!”
Reviews.Author: CalgarianTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed the minute we stepped off the elevator. The hall carpet was terrible! Stains everywhere. We Pricelined for a 4 Star thinking we would have a lovely room to lounge in for 5 days! Instead we got a dingy room with stained carpets, hair on the bed, cracked bathtub tiles with mold, view of roof outside the window, small room. We were stuck because you pay up front with Priceline. I called about 1 am that morning and they called the hotel and told them our complaints. Management came the next morning and moved us to slightly better rooms across the hall with a view of at least buildings and not a roof. Quality of room same as the other side of the hall though. We had to make the best of it and just stayed out touring all day instead of chilling like we wanted to do some of the time. Upsides: Nice lobby. The overpriced breakfast buffet was just okay. I liked the pastries and tea so I was satisfied. If we had not been travelling with family and could have left the hotel earlier we would have been much better off stopping at Starbucks for pastries and tea. Okay if you are going to be out all day and you don't care if the room is dingy. Close to metro with quick connnections everywhere. If you are looking for a 4 Star Quality don't book here. You will be disappointed I am not a complainer and hate to write negative reports but I would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and spacious hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: Applepie_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp for 5 nights. Before arrival we had heard some bad reviews that the hotel was more of a 3 star than a 4 star - however I wanted to see for myself and I must say, I would definitely class it as more of a 3 star accomodation.... The beds were comfortable and everything was supplied - soap, razor, shampoo, shower cap etc.. the room also had a safe for storing any valuables. I'd say the location wasn't bad as there was a metro stop right outside it, plenty of cafes around it, the noise in the bedroom (from the street) was ok. The beer, internet and breakfast fees however were rather on the expensive side. The best thing Id say about it would probably be the location (very close to Mont juic and Las Ramblas & the Maremagnum shopping centre) so really handy for exploring Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for a hotel that was convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: TravelwithD
Reviews.Content: The front desk was lovely and very helpful. The hotel was immaculately clean and we had everything we needed; not to mention it was ecco friendly...when you took the key out of the door on your way out the lights went out and when you came back in you had to put the key in the slot by the door for the lights to go on. Also, when you called for a wake up call your phone rang and the t.v. went on...they had a mini bar and a breakfast room that was very nice. The pastries were very fresh and the coffee was hot. Although they did not have decaf brewed only instant. We were able to walk to the sea port and LaRambla My only critism was the beds were on the hard side...but I managed to sleep anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Had money stolen”
Reviews.Author: RTravels143
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were very pleased. We upgraded our room and to have their breakfast every morning. We were here for 3 nights 4 days. Great location! our room was very nice, big bed and the breakfast was worth it. If you're a light breakfast eater there is a fruit, veggie and meat market by las ramblas. VERY GOOD AND FRESH! I brought all my euros and card with me at all times but i left my us dollars in my wallet in the room. I only had $37 and when i returned one night a $20 bill was gone! We told the young lady (not very nice) and she seemed to not care. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again, especially seeing the review below and how they had money stolen too. Other than the theft the hotel was nice. I will definitely use a safe from now on. I learned my lesson!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but had some money stolen”
Reviews.Author: Lfgrd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not bad the room could have better ac though. The staff was fine except the manager was very rude. I had 50 euros taken from my room and she checked the door to see who had used it and the cleaning staff went in after the room was clean in morning for no reason and my 50 was gone when I returned. She simply said she asked the cleaning lady and the cleaning lady said she did not see anything so I was out of luck. She could not even say sorry this happened or anything. I will not stay at the place again.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location but its *not* a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stevStAlbans
Reviews.Content: I found the staff helpful and polite, they gave great advice on how to for find places. Sadly there is a water fountain below our fifth floor room and late at night you are guaranteed a few drunks kids will want to play in it and wake you up, although traffic noise was *not* a problem. Rooms a basically furnished (thread bare towels and carpets) but they are kept clean; its nice a pleasant with great location its just not a four star hotel. Getting a non-smoking rooms is difficult plus you will be given a twin-bed, never queen as advised and paid for. I would only recommend it if the price was lower than other 3 star hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: texhills
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on Priceline in the 4 star class, so we were happy with the hotel. Really just used it as a place to sleep as we ate out. Not a lot of character to the place as other reviewers say. Our room on the 3rd floor had street noise during the night which woke us up...some rowdies up late. The staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but characterless”
Reviews.Author: phil2u
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a good location for walking to the main sites of Barcelona. It is clearly geared to the business traveler and to small groups (like the one I was with). The rooms are spacious, the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are clean and well appointed, the linens are above average. It is, however, large and rather unattractive, as noted by several other reviewers. My room was very quiet, but others in my group whose rooms faced the street reported street noise at night. The breakfast is one of the best I have encountered in this class range hotel in Europe. There was a large hot / cold buffet, fresh fruits and excellent breads. The coffee and teas were both excellent.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: holidaycrazyIndia
Reviews.Content: got a good deal on priceline.loved the hotel for its location and proximity to metro.ideal for shopping and close to la rambla.was there for one night only.beds were comfortable,though i wonder why we were not asked about our preference for twin beds or double bed.bathroom was clean with good toiletries.all in all it lived upto its 4 stars.a bit noisy because of the theatre below.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable...defintely not fancy...good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sunni30
Reviews.Content: Didn't intent to stay here but Renaissance overbooked our confirmed room and just took us here. Personnel were very professional. Hotel is a 3 Star, not 4. No options for late night eatingf. Rooms need updating..e.g., floor planks not totally joined and room wasn't fresh smelling

Reviews.Title: “Worn down, not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: natty33
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel room. The room was a bit run down and needed some repairs. The carpet was dirty and stained, the tiles in the bathroom were broken and the mildew in the bathroom was out of control. The location was convenient to the metro. However, the Apollo theater was downstairs (or next door?) and there was a loud late night concert going on. There were swarms of people hanging out outside the theater all night and it got loud. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: stelorIsleOfLewis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location metro and taxi outside hotel. we were on 5th floor looking onto main street a little noisey but not to bad. Our room was spacious also clean,toiletries provided.Found hotel pricey so we ate and drank at a bar across the street.Hotel staff were very helpful with the exception of one man at reception who was on point of being rude. We took about 8mins to walk to ramblas if you cut through side street. A central hotel within easy reach of all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, no problems”
Reviews.Author: Alethea48
Reviews.Content: Arrived early to the hotel and although check in was 2pm they had the key ready for us. The room was plenty big enough, nice bathroom and a working safe. We were on the 4th floor facing the main road. The only noise tended to be from the ambulances/police cars but it was ok. The Metro Paralel was right outside the hotel and there were plenty of cafes nearby and Las Ramblas was only 3 stops away. The hotel staff were very friendly and told us what time the metro ran as it was different at weekends than during the week. All in all a good hotel and great location. Beware of pickpockets though, although we didn't get pickpocketed, some people did that we spoke to.

Reviews.Title: “Rusty 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: euine
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in May 2010 in this hotel (standard room)). General impression – not bad but not 4 stars. Location is not central but quite good – 15-20 min walking to Rambla Port (Aquarium, shopping center, restaurants etc) and singing fountain. Right outside of the hotel is metro Para.lel (beware of pickpockets they are very active in metro!). Taxi station is right outside the hotel and it is cheaper than in may Western European cities. You can get to most attractions for up to 10 euro. We had a nonsmoking room under the casino and it was really noisy on the Friday and Saturday nights due to many people outside speaking/singing loudly. So if your sleep is sensitive ask for noncasino side of the hotel. The hotel is huge they have many options. Room is more or less fine. The bed is normal. Carpeting is really worn and dirty. Iron items in the bathroom are rusty. Noise isolation from outside is poor. Daily cleaning was good as well as room service. Reception/concierge were quite helpful in practical issues however often we had to wait up to 5 min to get to them (as I said hotel is huge and sometimes there were a lot of people at reception). Breakfast is acceptable, especially if you stay 1-2 nights. All 4 nights it was always the same. On peak days (weekend) there were too many people in the breakfast room so the feeling is like in a huge canteen. We took the option of having a breakfast for 10,7 euro per person per day. Got the room through priceline (128 USD per night per double room).

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel needs updating, not nice location”
Reviews.Author: chica_world
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early May for 4 nights. It really should be rated as a poor 3 star not 4 star. The hotel needs to be refurbished to a good standard as there was a lot of bodged DIY attempts in sight (see photos). We were first given room 106 facing the side street- above a discoteque - needless to say it was like if we were having a party in our room, specially in the bathroom - and the only thing I wanted to do was wind down for the day. We asked to be changed that night but were told there was no rooms. We then went back after midday as advised but got told again there were no rooms - apparently a group of people had just taken all the available ones! Only after asking to speak to a supervisor and after the reception clerk made a phone call - then "suddenly" there was a room available!! if you get my point. This room was on the forth floor and not facing the street. The insulation between rooms was poor but managed to have a good night sleep, the double glazing does not work, there was still cracked titles, worn out and wobbly taps and toilet seats, stained ceiling tiles, the bathroom door could not be closed properly, the bed was not conformble either but it was better than the room we were allocated first as there was less noise. We did not have breaksfast in the hotel at 10 euros per head, best to head to Cafe Spaniola across the road where the coffee and food is much better and less expensive. Althougth the location is handy as the metro is just outside the hotel, the neightborohood is not the nicest, as you have to go through some red light streets to get to Ramblas, can feel intimidating. Also the road outside is not very nice and busy. I felt cheated as his hotel was mis-sold to us as a 4 star. We booked via "Named your price" - not knowing where we would stay but offering a good price apparently (which by the way it was not good as we found the hotel 80GBP cheaper on other sites - we did eventually get a refund). I would not book a hotel not knowing where it was again as I would prefer to stay in a nice 3 star hotel and not on a bad 4 star one.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: Najun
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, can walk to Ramblas, buses outside to main attractions also metro right outside hotel. Rooms comfortable, toileteries provided which is great if you only bring carryon luggage. We had half price breakfast which was very good value. All staff friendly and helpful especially when on the 16th we had to change hotel, reception staff phoned new hotel so we could have directions , cost of taxi. Great if you like nightlife or should ask for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy for town and good late opening cafe”
Reviews.Author: yourstruly062
Reviews.Content: This is a satisfactory, standard city break or businessman's hotel that you see throughout Europe. There was everything we needed in the room including toothbrush. We recommend you ask for a quiet room though as we were kept awake by the metrolink on our first night. All the bathrooms we saw had rusty fixtures and fittings so guess that must be a common problem. Staff were professional and helpful and spoke English. Very expensive but probably because its so close to the centre of town. It was good to be able to get a bedtime drink and snack in the cafe when we got in at night. There were a couple of thefts in the public areas which is the only reason I would not recommend it to friends as not everyone is as careful as us.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: MarioAlberto
