Reviews.Content: Stayed there because I have plenty of points to redeem from a long previous Business Stay in another Meliá Hotel . Hotel has excellent location and is really near to the train station (AVE-Barcelona Saints), you only have to take the subway, travel two stations and the hotel is located just outside Paralel Station . The room was clean, and quiet in spite of having a window facing Paralel Avenue. Didnt like the fact that I asked for a Queen Size bed and was given two smaller beds that were previously arranged and joined as one. Call room service to lend a corkscrew, and was told to go downstairs and take the bottle of wine and have it opened in the bar, small detail but, makes me feel like there is not good enough service.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at Tryp Apolo again, and would recommend it if you want to be in that area of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Gretaway
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Tryp Apolo, from the end of March until the beginning of April, 2010. We are a married couple and we brought two teenagers. We booked the hotel online, without knowing the area or the city. Since the hotel is rated four stars, we thought it would be okay, and it was. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly. At night, outside the hotel was a little dicey and a little noisy, but we wanted to be in the center of the city and within walking distance of our interests, and it was. They had a security guard in the lobby at night, and that made us feel safe enough that we allowed the teenagers to use the computers on a different floor without us. (Free wi-fi would have been nice, but they charge 3 euros a half hour or 4 euros for an hour of computer time in their business center.) The hotel is 3 blocks from the marina center, and you can get just about anyplace within a 20 minute walk. We had a great time and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Just be careful at night.

Reviews.Title: “A 'Tryp' you may want to forget”
Reviews.Author: ImYourMan
Reviews.Content: I'll begin by this review by saying that the hotel itself appears tidy and the staff were somewhat courteous. However, this is not a 4-star class hotel. In fact, it is barely a 3-star. The Tryp Apolo is conveniently located just a few steps away from the underground subway (tube) station, but this hotel is also connected to a casino where the patrons tend to be a little loud and you will hear them until almost 4 am every morning just outside your window. Even if your room is on the 5th floor. There is no escape from this noisy commotion when you are trying to sleep. The hotel's interior is what really gets me. I found black marks on the walls, tears in the upholstery, cracked, moldy tiles in the shower and a safe that would not lock. Also, please be aware that the hotel does not offer free internet and the staff at the front desk may persuade you to purchase breakfasts for several days in advance. If you happen to agree to these breakfasts, you will not get your money back for a breakfast that you may skip.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever for 4 star”
Reviews.Author: rendezvous3
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel. and a shame for being a part of Melia Hotels. if you enjoy being ripped off then this is a perfect hotel. Old worn out furniture, cracked bathroom tiles, not a quiet location, seedy area. Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: Ver17
Reviews.Content: I went here in June 2009 with my partner and my little brother and his friend. I have to say the service I received was exceptional. I was a bit unsure when I booked this break as me and my partner have only ever done 5* but as this was a short break I thought it wouldn't be a problem and I was so right. We arrived at the hotel at about 12pm and the hotel reception was really busy when booking the break we were told that we wouldn't be able to get a room until 2pm. How wrong was that we arrived and the staff were more than helpful to find us our room. The room we had was a really god size and the bed was really comfortable I can't comment on the TV entertainment as we didn't watch TV whilst we were there. Oh the internet service is really good to and even though the hotel is on the main road you don't here any traffic noise. I have recommended this hotel to all my friends that are going to Barcelona and I will be returning here in June 2010 :-)

Reviews.Title: “Some things I´d like to have had”
Reviews.Author: vcesare
Reviews.Content: The only two problems I´ve noticed were: they did not have breakfast included and they did not have free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Loversofshortbreaks
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, 10 mins walk from La Ramblas and port area, and on the end of the purple metro line so getting around is simple. The room is fairly standard for a hotel of this quality and price. At breakfast there was a good selection of fruit, pastries, cold hams and roasted tomatoes, eggs and bacon to fill yourself up before a day of sightseeing. Staff were friendly and helpful. If you are on the front side of the hotel expect night time noise as the hotel is above a theatre and entrance/exit to the Metro. The only thing that let it down for the price was that the mattresses were uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “over priced , dirty , broken tiels , would not be rated a 2* in Ireland .”
Reviews.Author: Galwaygirl69
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel on way back from cruise .It was convent to the port but thats about all that it has to offer. Paid 107 euos for room and no breackfast. There was not even a tea making tray or water to drink. tyles were broken in bathroom and was not clean. Bed linen was scant and air condition was noicey.There is much nicer hotels 'much better rates..........

Reviews.Title: “Yuck and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: margarbi
Reviews.Content: Not friendly staff, seemed annoyed at any communication with them. The room was dirty and the sheets were stiff and itchy. The room smelled old and yucky. Bathroom floor was visibly dirty. Location was not that great and we paid way too much to stay there. We also stayed at the Regina Hotel at the top of Las Ramblas and it was way nicer and a better price!

Reviews.Title: “very convenient for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: donot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for the price and much better than expected after reading so many negative reviews here. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Towels were big and thick. Staff were courteous and helpful. There was absolutely no pressure at all to book the breakfast buffet at checkin. It was good for 10.70 euros and includes juice and coffee. This hotel is conveniently located right at a subway station for the L2 and L3 subway lines and a short walk to La Rambla (via Carrer Nou De La Rambla which felt very safe to walk in the early evening) and the Columbus Monument. Sagradia Famila is only 10 minutes away on the L2 subway line. It did not feel to us like the hotel was in a creepy or seedy part of town as other reviewers have said, but we were too jet lagged to stay out late so can’t comment on what it is like at night. During the day and evening we had no fears for our safety at all in this area other than the need to guard against pickpockets, but you must be careful not just here but everywhere in Barcelona. We used the hotel’s free luggage storage service after we checked out in the morning, hopped on the subway to do some sightseeing, then took the subway back to the hotel to pick up our luggage in the afternoon. It is just one subway stop ride or a short walk to the port shuttle bus at the Columbus Monument. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well positioned for a short stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: GaelicBodyguard
Reviews.Content: A good hotel but a bit lacking in facilities. The room was a typical hotel room - no frills but comfortable. Probably a three star by Irish standards. The hotel is well positioned about 15 minutes from the centre of the old city. The breakfast was very good and not too expensive. Some excellent restaurants in the general vicinity. Staff were helpful and couteous.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: SueHodson
Reviews.Content: After reading some poor reviews about 2 weeks before our break we were quite concerned as to what we would find on our arrival. However, our doubts were unfounded. The staff were helpful and the room along with the bathroom was clean. We requested more pillows and these were provided almost immediately. For the age of the hotel the room was well upto standard. The daily servicing of the room was very good and we certainly didn't find any of our belongings had been placed in a drawer (as did an earlier reviewer) on our return later in the day. The breakfast was also good with an excellent choice of fruit along with continental or cooked breakfast. Pots of coffee and milk were placed on our table almost as soon as we sat down. In addition we were offered a ground floor room or 6th floor room with a balcony.(we opted for this one as we like to sleep with our window open). Yes, it was somewhat noisy but we feel sure that it would have been quieter had the windows have been closed. Despite this we were not kept awake hour upon hour and in fact slept better than we do in our village environment at home. Perhaps we were exceptionally tired due to exploring the area on foot. Most of the tourist areas are within walking distance form the hotel all be it medium distance walks but surely people visit cities like Barcelona to take walking tours and see the local sites. We would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: YorkMuddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday. The room was disappointing from the start. The carpets were filthy, the bathroom had cracked tiles, the bath was yellow and heavily pitted where is was once white. The sink was blocked when we arrived so we had to get someone to unblock it as soon as we arrived. We had a balcony but it was so noisy from the busy road below. The noise went on through the night with emergency sirens frequently waking us up through the night. The cleaner only seemed to keep moving our property and putting it in drawers (perhaps hoping we'd forget it when we left) It was such a disappointing stay. Outside the hotel wasn't much better, the hotel was located in a creepy part of town and I definitely felt scared at night. We were shouted at by one man just outside the hotel who swore repeatedly at us and told my partner to murder me. I wouldn't go anywhere near again. It certainly didn't deserve its 4* rating.

Reviews.Title: “very surprised”
Reviews.Author: masonwba
Reviews.Content: after constantly reading bad reports on here,me and my wife was expecting the worse from our stay at the apollo,we stayed for 3 days on 24oct ,and really had to write a review to say ,we loved it we didnt have 1 problem with our stay here at all,room was very clean,big and comfortable ,over looking the main road out the front of hotel,but coulnt really hear the traffic ,the breakfast was good with lots of choice and variety,all the staff was very nice and polite during our stay,we thought the hotel location was excellent ,a few minutes walk to the ramblas,or the port ,metro station outside and bus stops which is handy,and taxi rank outside hotel door also,so basically after all the negativity about this hotel,we loved it and would definately recommend this to our friends ,and will be returning in the future,this is just our opinion

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Tryp at all”
Reviews.Author: DJHunter
Reviews.Content: I had been somewhat apprehensive about my stay at the Tryp Apolo after reading some of the reviews. But I was pleasantly surprised. We were greeted by a very helpful receptionist who spoke excellent English and asked us if we wanted a room on the quiet interior of the building. We were put under no pressure to upgrade or to add breakfast to our booking. The room was comfortable and clean with bedding of the kind I have come to expect in most hotels in Mediterranean countries - no duvet but sheets and blanket, with extra blankets in the room if you need them. The bathroom was perfectly clean and the towels were a good size. Shower was fine. The hairdryer was a fixed one and not very powerful but I've found this in a lot of hotels. The staff who looked after our baggage after the checkout were very helpful and efficient. On the minus side, I think the air conditioning could be an issue in the summer months. It didn't seem to be very powerful. The location of the hotel seems to be a problem to several reviewers. We didn't find the area at all threatening, though. We walked along Carrer Nou de la Rambla each day and walked up the Avinguda Paral-lel without any incident at all. We also used the very convenient Metro station with no problems. My husband was approached by one prostitute near the hotel - who simply went away when he pretended he couldn't understand what she was saying. We only had one approach from a drug dealer - on the Via Laetana which is well away from the hotel area. The area isn't the most beautiful but it's very easy to get to most places in the city from it. And there are a couple of very decent places to eat nearby. I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: lfvilla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights and had mixed feelings about this. Good - staff very friendly and helpful, got a quiet room when we asked for one, next to metro station, excellent location for exploring, comfy beds, we got an offer of £35 per night on Lastminute.com so great value Bad - cracked tiles, the toilet 'dripped' all night but this was mended as soon as we told reception, 3* at best, location is good but must admit the walk down the street to the Ramblas is quite dark with various locals hanging around (I felt safe as I was with my husband but if I was with a friend I would have definitely get the metro back). We didn't see any drug dealing but there were a few sex shops close by. As with most things it depends what you pay - we had great value for money compared to other hotels we'd looked at - but if you're paying £60-£70+ plus per night I think you can probably get better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this hotel, please!!!”
Reviews.Author: GreySaintCroix_USVI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before and after a cruise. I have to say that if it wouldn’t be because we paid in advance we wouldn't come back to this trash. The first room we had for only one night was horrible, two twins bed and the carpet wasn't even vacuum, when I reached the maid she told me that the carpet it was already wasted, and she couldn't do anything I don’t blame her but... if she had a decent vacuum cleaner she could do something about it. The hotel looked like busy maybe because of its prices, very attractive compare to the hotels in Las Ramblas, which were between 200-300 euros. Ridiculous!!! Location not so bad but considering that the doorman himself told us not to go outside to wait to be picked up because of the crime. The hotel is not in a nice neighborhood. Please don’t go to this hotel or even this city is quite expensive, Las Ramblas is just a walk with some magazines stands and some old architecture buildings, but I was lucky they didn't take my money or may purse as this is one of their specialties in Barcelona. And if you don’t smoke prepare to be miserable, in Spain they smoke indoors, outdoors, in your face and they don't care. This hotel is so different of what they show in pictures and online, doorman and luggage guys wonderful, but besides that… not worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: chrismull82
Reviews.Content: A terrible, terrible experience. Stayed with a group of friends and will not be back. Rude and threatening staff who in no way shape or form do anything to help you or make your stay an enjoyable one. Very average rooms. As others will testify, broken appliances, stained carpets etc. Not far from la rambla, however, the walk there is shall we say an entertaining one. I was mugged 250 yards from the hotel whilst another friend was also jumped and had his wallet, phone etc taken. The hotel is situated beside a very dodgy area. In the hotel people were being mugged on a daily basis, with 5 occurring in one day whilst we were there. Please also note that drug dealing takes place outside the hotel as we witnessed several times. All in all an expensive trip. Barcelona seems like a nice city...Its just a pity that this hotel and the surrounding area cost us dear.

Reviews.Title: “Okay rooms (old, broken tiles), good hospitality, mediocre breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gogol80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Tryp Apolo for 9 nights during a summer trip to Barcelona for a business workshop. Overall, we really liked the location -- I could walk (15 minutes) to the Convention Center (WTC), and it was less than 15 minutes walk to the La Rambla -- the most happening street in Barcelona. The metro station is a few yards from the hotel door. We rented a scooter during our stay and could park it right outside the hotel entrance on marked scooter spots, for free. The staff was very helpful and courteous, and there always was one english speaking staff at the front desk, which was invaluable to us. but... The room are in dire need of renovation. We had requested a room with a queen bed. The first room we were given had a queen sized bed. Everything was fine, until we noticed a few minutes after we had entered the room, that the AC was not working. We complained to the front desk staff and they sent an electrician. The guy took the AC apart as we watched curiously and after a lot of dusting and cleaning the wires, he couldn't figure out what the problem was. We were sent to another room, which now had two twin sized beds. We were promised that we would be given a room with a queen sized bed as soon as one frees up. This second room had it lamp shades cracked, and there were lots of cracks on the bathroom tiles. The bathroom didn't have a shampoo that evening (thank God we carried one with us!). The following day, we were given a room with a queen bed. This room also had several things broken, the AC was painstakingly slow, but room service staff was very regular and we had an overall comfortable stay. The breakfast buffet had a lot of items, but was quite mediocre in quality. We took the breakfast option primarily out of convenience. It worked out okay. The above is my honest experience of my stay with Tryp Apolo. Given the wonderful location of the hotel and the very competitive room rates for the location, if you aren't that picky about your room, and don't mind a slow AC and few broken tiles in your bathroom, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average hotel Not close to a 4 star...More like a 1 1/2”
Reviews.Author: SarahMaryNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, staff Oscar and Jorge could not be ruder. The baggage staff was great, fast and nice. The carpets are all stained in the hallways and rooms. I found some sort of bug crawling on nightstand. There was little to no A/C and the tub had mold...GROSS. They hook you in to buy breakfast buffet for 10 euro but must purchase for whole stay. That should have been a huge red flag to say NOOOOOOO but I fell for it! The eggs were close to raw and the bacon was raw. Their idea of sausage is mini disgusting hot dogs. I asked for non-smoking room but was given smoking room. The issue of noise wasn't that bad. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good European hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sidney0807
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't understand how people can complain about this place. Yes - the hotel is not in a "beautiful" area of Barcelona, but it is a fabulous location - a 5 minute walk from Las Ramblas, a 15 - 20 minute walk to the beach, and right next to a Metro Station. We had no problems with rude staff - in fact everyone was very friendly. I have stayed in several European hotels and I must say this was the most "modern" of all of them. The breakfast was delicious and I could not have asked for more. I want to know who goes to Barcelona and stays in their room the majority of the time - those are the people that seem to complain the most. I have been to pretty dangerous areas in the US and not once did I ever feel like I was in any kind of danger while staying at the Tryp Apolo. I'm assuming those people that complained that it was in a terrible section of Barcelona have never been in a real dangerous location before. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people who don't care about 5 star accomodations and who want to be in a great location with access to major sites. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended by Costa - I agree!”
Reviews.Author: Alysb
Reviews.Content: On a recent 2 night stay, before boarding a Costa ship with departure in Barcelona, I would recommend this hotel for the location & service. Upon an early AM arrival, we were informed that a room was available, but it was a smoking room. We were advised to wait til early afternoon - go see some sites and return. Our luggage was promptly stored under lock and key and the reception desk personnel explained with a map our location and walking distance to the Hop on Hop off bus near the Columbus monument. Upon our return, after a nice paella lunch at a nearby restaurant, a lovely young lady at reception checked us in and we received a corner 2 room suite. Thank you to the staff! Breakfast selections are very nice. . spacious room with window and terrace views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, near but not to near”
Reviews.Author: Merlin17
Reviews.Content: Location is great, right by the bus stop and right by the Metro, also only a ten min walk to Las Ramblas. We satyed in a quiet room that didnt over look the main busy road, so i would recommend asking for this. Hotel in general was clean with polite and helpful staff - although at times they could of done wth more staff behind reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: spencerf
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, the staff was very friendly. I got into the room and the room was average sized, clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The actual neighborhood of the hotel is not the nicest area in Barcelona although the location of the hotel is very convenient. The metro station is located on the same block. There is a taxi stand outside of the hotel and the hotel is surrounded by internet cafes (or Locutorios as they say in spain), cafes and Döner Kebab restaurants (very good falafel). It is a 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas and the Colon statue. It is also very close to Montjuïc which you can access by taking the funicular from the Parallel metro stop (the metro stop on the block of the hotel) where you have excellent views of the city. The rooms have wifi although it is quite expensive (17 euro for 24 hours). I believe you can pay 4 euros for an hour instead of paying the full 17 euros. There are also computers on the terrace floor which are 3 euros an hour but I recommend walking down the street to a locutorio where it is about 90 cents an hour. Overall, the hotel is clean, convenient and an inexpensive choice for a 4 star Barcelona hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Enjoyinglifeforfun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after a cruise. Great location. Easy walk to everything for sight seeing. Room was nice, needed some repairs, but still nice. On our last nights stay, we were upgraded to a larger room at no extra cost. Dinner was great at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't worth hit!”
Reviews.Author: Pro89
Reviews.Content: Things were not looking good when we arrived. They gave us the wrong room, a double when it should have been a twin, in what could only be described as the dingiest and tiniest room on earth. After making us wait 2 hours initially, because the rooms were not ready, we had to wait for another hour for the staff to find us the right room. The reception staff were rude and saracstic, claiming we had only waited 15 mins, when it had clearly been over an hour. When we finally got the rooms, we were not impressed. Like many other reviewers have mentioned, this is in no way a 4 star establisment. One room had drink stains on the walls, broken tables, and the other one had broken hall lights, and both rooms had a massive amount of limescale and rust in the bathrooms, perpetuated by the poor ventilation. The beds were a right laugh. Hard, small and uncomfortable, the 'blankets' only consisted of a very thin duvet cover. I had a little sunburn on the beach one day and woke up the next day to find the abarasive bedsheets had rubbed my shoulder and back raw. It was very painful. The pillows were the best part, they were so extraordinarily thin (measuring one inch in thickness), we all had neck cramps on a daily basis. The decor was tired, and the facilities were poor. The gym was quite good,but the promised 'swimming pool' did NOT exist. The internet was also not working throughout the duration of our one week stay. When we checked out of our rooms, we waited in the lounge for an hour or so as we had a late flight, but the miserable security guard was having none of it. He loitered around our chairs, complained to the reception in Spanish, and followed me to the toilets in the basement. I was so fed up, I complained to management, and despite acknowledging I was right, the staff were still very rude and kept an eye on us. In retropsect the only good thing about the hotel was the location. I would not recommend this awful hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Waxworkfish
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel. When we arrived, the receptionist seemed intent on selling us additional extras which we didn't want. The actual hotel is clean and pleasant enough, however the room was pretty poor. We had to request clean towels on three of the five days. The hairdryer, air conditioning and phone were all not working properly. There was rust all over the bath and holes in the ceiling with water dripping down. The TV reception was poor on every channel. How this hotel claims to be 4 star I have no idea. The location wasn't too bad, close to the harbour and Las Ramblas, however the 5 minute walk to the main strip passes a street full of prostitues. I found this pretty entertaining but I imagine some people may feel intimidated by it. There are far better hotels in Barcelona for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good location, good AC”
Reviews.Author: DavidFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Apolo for 7 nights while attending a conference at the World Trade Centre. It was about a 15 minute walk to the WTC which is out in the harbor. The hotel is right beside the metro station Parallel. I took the train from the airport to Sants station, then changed to the metro there directly to Parallel. The trip counted as one trip on the T10 metro card. The room was larger than most European hotels, although smaller than say a Hyatt hotel in the US. The room was tastefully decorated with wood trim and some artwork. The bathroom was finished in marble. I asked for a room on the inside, away from the road, and it was very quiet. I had two colleagues in other rooms facing the street -- one said the street noise was annoying, the other didn't mind. The air conditioning was excellent, and the window could open wide if you wanted it. Security -- smoke detector in room, sprinklers in hallways, electronic key card access, dead bolt plus chain on door, electronic safe large enough for a laptop. The WiFi was provided by SwissCom. IT was pretty expensive at 88 Euros for the week. The information card said that wired internet was available for free, but I couldn't find the Ethernet connector. I prepaid on Expedia.ca, CAD116 per night (USD105, Euro75), including all taxes and fees. There was no hassle at the front desk when checking in or leaving, although they pushed hard to sell the breakfast at 10 Euros. Barcelona has lots of thiefs. I am aware of about 10 thefts from among the 500 people at my conference, from pickpockets on the metro, to a swarming, to someone's bag being taken while checking into a hotel (not this one). Use the hotel room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel- but service very poor”
Reviews.Author: Drkiwi
Reviews.Content: I travel around the world a lot for work and I did not enjoy my stay at this hotel. Overall it was an ok hotel but the service and used car salesmen vibe from the front desk spoilt it for us. To add as well, I am not a demanding customer, for this trip my interactions with the front desk involved leaving a message for a colleague, asking for directions, help with getting around and resolving charges on the hotel room. The negatives:- Unhelpful front desk, often too busy and not accomodating even for the simplest task of directions (they're answer is always, "take a taxi" even around the corner, to me that is an extreme answer for something close by)..morever once my colleague had a question on directions as well and was told "this is not a good time, can you come back in half an hour"; when asked for a late checkout, "call back later, we are busy" I did not think the facilities were bad at all but when you check in they are quite mercenary, "would you like an upgrade...because...small, etc". This made me think there was something wrong with the room I originally booked. They do not stop there, they will also push other offers. It gave me the impression that the front desk was run by used car salesmen. Seems to me they only care if they can make money off you. Room wasn't cleaned properly when I checked in, condom wrapper on floor, toiletries not there. Also, do not pay for the internet they provide as they use really old slow computers and their internet connection is slow. I paid to use it for 1/2 hour and pretty much only had 10 minutes online as it took so long to load pages. Go to a nearby internet cafe. Positives: Good location- very central, although there is a subway that goes underneath you can hear but not too loud Price- cheapest in Barcelona for the location (quite central) Cleaning lady was accomodating - although the extra blanket I asked for disappeared the next day- and re-appeared the day after Facilities were ok, not amazing but serviceable I did not enjoy staying here, the customer service was very poor and they only seemed interested in money.

Reviews.Title: “CARE - No way a 4 star... and the location's not great either...”
Reviews.Author: Europeanb0b
Reviews.Content: For those who just like a short review/summary, I'd say that this hotel is 'OK' at best, not that I'd stay there again mind you. If you like more detail, read on... I just returned from Barcelona yesterday, having stayed 5 nights at the Tryp Apolo with my girlfriend and friends. Let's do the GOOD points first: * The hotel is, as advertised, geographically well located; near the heart of the city, the Ramblas etc etc. However, see also the BAD points of this review. * The reception desk staff were very helpful, polite and spoke excellent English. * The mini-bar drinks were reasonably priced; I hate paying £5 for a water. Now the BAD stuff: * There is NO WAY this is a 4 star hotel by anyone's standards. The facilities on offer were as you would expect from a 2 or 3 star, but no more. There wasn't even coffee or tea making facilities (i.e. a kettle) in the room! * This may have been a smartly decorated place when it opened (I'm guessing about 7 years ago) but the carpets, walls, bathroom tiles etc are now well worn. ALL the fittings in our bathroom were rusty! * This is NOT a nice part of town. To get to/from the Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter etc you will have to walk down the street opposite, past strip joints etc. There's a peep show dead opposite the hotel. It's not too bad in the day but if you're not confident running the gauntlet of pimps and pushers at night, DO NOT stay here. And don't let any of the guidebooks try to tell you that this part of town was all 'cleaned up' a number of years back, in time for the Olympics; it wasn't. I have been to many major cities - I go out a good deal - but I felt uncomfortable and vulnerable when walking to/from this hotel after dark. I lost count of the number of pushers carrying and offering 'beer' for sale, which of course became 'hash', ‘coke’, ‘charlie’ as you got in speaking distance. There must have been 30 guys in just 100 metres (yards), 10 of which were within spitting distance of the front door… I know that pushers and other dodgy folk are not the responsibility of the hotel and realistically, there’s noting the hotel can do about them. I also know that inner city crime, drugs etc are a problem all round the world. But I don’t expect to pay big money for a “4 star” hotel which is a 3 star at best, in an unsafe part of the city. Oh, and incidentally, 3 robbers attacked one of my friends on the Metro before he’d even got to the hotel. Unluckily for them, he’s a police officer, so instead of his cash, passport, i-pod etc, they got a few broken noses. You don't have to walk everywhere in Barcelona, but you might want to consider it... No matter how you travel, keep your whits about you. Barcelona – probably won’t ever go back; there’s many nicer places in the world. Tryp Apolo – definitely won’t go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 6 days in June”
Reviews.Author: screenname2000
Reviews.Content: We had a 6-day stay at the hotel and my wife was very happy with the experience. The room was large, clean and comfortable the bathroom had mildew in a couple of places however the bedroom A/C worked well. It’s right on the Parallel metro stop so it’s really quick to get all over town. Bus number 24 starts 4 to 5 minute walk away and it goes way across town to Parc Guell so you get to see places you would not usually see. I would not stay here again unless I got the 30% discount I had this time otherwise I think I would be paying too much. Did not eat at the hotel but had breakfast in the local places and watched the world go by (I do not speak a word of Spanish but the local were very friendly if they saw you a second time)

Reviews.Title: “Good location & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JOHNKENT
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to Harbor and Las Ramblas. Breakfast very good. Front staff was generally pleasant if somewhat cold. Rooms nice size and close to Metro. Not real close to other resturants, at least that I could find. Also a good walk to get to night life in general.

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic and the hotel was fab”
Reviews.Author: fishtank9
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room on the net for just under a 100euro per night for 3 nights from Friday to Monday. On arrival at the hotel, we were told that the hotel was quite full and we were been upgraded to a suite for the same price. The suite was fantastic..... all toiletries provided, fluffy white bathrobes, towels and a double ensuite bedroom with a sitting room just off it. The rooms were extremely clean with a maid service every day. Hairdryer, iron, mini bar and a safe for valuables all provided and the room was air conditioned. Could not fault the stay at all, definately a 4 star. We didn't eat in the hotel because we thought the breakfast overpriced and it was cheaper to eat in any of the cafes on the same street. We were out all day and ate in the restaurants off LA Ramblas. We were a 5 minute walk from Las Ramblas, turn right outside hotel and cross road to take st. Monica street which meets Las ramblas near the Colombus monument. Some of the connecting streets were probably a bit dodgy after dark but during the day were very busy and safe. We noticed a lot of police around both day and night. We took a taxi back each night and paid between 5 and 7 euro. The avenue paralel which we were staying on, is as it's name suggests a parallel street to las ramblas. The staff had good english and the upgrade to a suite was a major plus and the location couldn't be better. I would definately stay here again. Taxi from airport cost 28 euro to the hotel and 24 euro going back. Make sure to take the open top tourist bus- a ticket for two days cost 27euro each. A tourist information office is located on Las Ramblas near plaza catalunya. Everyone from the shops. hotel staff, restaurants and tour guides all had excellent english which made it very easy to communicate. Also if using your credit card in any shop/restaurant make sure to bring photo id as they won't accept card without it. Make sure to check in your passport details in advance if travelling from Ireland. Barcelona is a beautiful city and a lovely city for a short break. Loads to see with Las ramblas and its mime artists and all kinds of markets, la sagrieda familia (gaudi's unfinished cathedral) and the harbour area make it a beautiful city break.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: sonalim
Reviews.Content: Room was really nice and clean. The staff at the front desk did not know too much about sight-seeing options in Barcelona. Very good location, right near the Parall-el metro station. Breakfast was good but not the best.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: shazb-2009
Reviews.Content: although the hotel was in a good location it was not worth 4 star at all. i booked this for my boyfriends birthday when we arrived the hotel looked really nice but for the first 2 nights of our stay we did not sleep as there is a night club underneath the hotel and from 3am until 7am we were awake as the noise was so loud it woke you up. for the third night of our stay i complained at reception and they did move us to a much nicer room at the other side of the hotel. the first room was not clean it smelt strongly of smoke,had an hole in the wall and the bathroom tiles were all cracked. if you want a nice hotel for a relaxing few days i would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: murp0172
Reviews.Content: Three words for this hotel. Location, Location, Location. Literally next to the Green L3 and Purple L2 Parel-lel stop on one of the main roads in Barcelona. A very easy 5 minute walk straight to Las Ramblas, 10 minutes to Columbus statue, the Funucular to the top of Barcelona is at that same stop and highly recommended on a clear day. Overall, this hotel was ranked as a 4* on Hotwire, more like a 2 ½ star, but shower works, not dirty, rooms could use a makeover, but for the $52/night I paid in March, I will take it. Another note, a 10 minute walk down Paral-lel is a tapas bar called Inopia, one of, if not the best in Barcelona. Google it. Great

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: dcurt19
Reviews.Content: The guys at the desk were kind of rude and trying to make money off of us. We asked them about Barcelona football tickets and they quotes us a price that was almost 20 euros more than us just going to the ticket office. They were also pretty pushy at check in to try and get you to upgrade the room. One whole side of the hotel was on a very busy street so kind of noisy as well. Overall the hotel was average. Good location, decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravelerDK
Reviews.Content: I have visited Barcelona many times, each time staying at a new hotel. I am re-visiting Barceona end of April this, and I have booked a room at Tryp-Apolo again. The price is very fair for a 4-star hotel and the rooms are large with good bathroom facilities. Fira Palace is a better hotel (no doubt), but the location sucks. There are 2 metro lines just outside the hotel. Furthermore you can walk to the water front and the Rambla. etc. I did not try the breakfast but there are plenty of local places where you can buy a breakfast at a very reasonable price. Try the Confiteria, I have included a picture

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, not professiona reception desk, bad area, never again”
Reviews.Author: mohansen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at solemelia brand hotels before but this one is the exception. I was the worst experience ever right from the start. despite having the copy of my reservation they tried very hard to add extra surcharge for my child although it was listed in my reservation. check your bill when checking out. they added some else restaurant bill to my bill. the hotel area is in the bad and dangerous area of Barcelona not for Families. Be ware.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: chrisconnolly285
Reviews.Content: i stayed in alot of places but this 1 was the best,loved every min of it.cant wait 2 go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 57GalwayGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January, and it was only two minutes from the Metro station. You are about two stops always from the rambles the busy shopping area. There are some nice pubs and restaurants nearby. We found the hotel very clean and good value. (Our total stay was €200 for three nights stay) The Staff were very friendly and great for helping us.

Reviews.Title: “Very plesant stay”
Reviews.Author: Bluemilky1968
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great for what we needed, check in was fine and was offered breakfast for €10 each as it was not included in our booking and was average. Room was great with a balcony, traffic was noisy but did die down later at night. There was no resturant open at night but there was a cafe next door run by the hotel, were you could get snacks etc.. The bar opened at 6pm and closed at 12am on the dot but it may be differnt in the summer. Would stay there again at the discunted rate that we paid to go

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel, fairly seedy area”
Reviews.Author: OperaOnTheTurnpike
Reviews.Content: As usual, the Tryp Apolo is a modern, efficient hotel. The rooms were OK, though a bit in need of refurbishment. Not much more to say about it. The reception staff were kind, helpful, the breakfast was pretty good, and the WiFi internet connection worked more or less (it went down a few times, but it was easily solved just turning the wireless button off and on again. The thing about this hotel is the area. Sure it's a short walk to Pza Catalunya... yet a world away! the Tryp is at the edge of the Raval, which is, to be honest, a very seedy area with some quite creepy streets full of dodgy people wandering around. The Raval is also a red-light district, so you have plenty of ladies of the night (particularly in the southern part), who I have nothing against, except if you're a male they won't leave you alone until you.get angry. I personally didn't feel unsafe in the surrounding area, but it depends on each one, so some may feel unsafe or scared. What is very clear is that if the issues above mentioned are of your concern, then you should look for another place. Ignore all the usual euphemism about areas like this ("funky", "trendy", "picturesque", "gentrified"...), this is NOT a nice area by any means. It may be convenient in terms of distance to more attactive parts of town, but it really is an inner city (not meaning central, but... you know... the "american sense of the word"...). As for the Tryp Apolo, everything correct. No problems...

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in Apolo - for a little less money”
Reviews.Author: DeniMu
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the new year break for four nights. I assume this time of year is pretty expensive to stay in the city as what I paid was well above what I normally would pay and while the hotel stay was pleasant and I have no real negative things to say, the price was overinflated definitely for the standard of this hotel. For a lesser price though I would have been very happy. It is supposed to be four star business hotel – for me it is more like a very good three star. The hotel check in was smooth and efficient. There were no issues with the booking or the pre-payments which had been made. We were able to check in before official check in time of 1pm which was good and on the day of check out they stored our bags securely for the day until we returned that evening to collect them. Service at all times was excellent from the reception staff to the porters, security, restaurant staff and maid service, and very friendly. The reception staff spoke excellent English and we were provided with a map of Barcelona on arrival. The room we were allocated was at the back on the hotel so it was quiet enough. The room was as seen on the pictures they use to advertise the hotel except that I asked for double bed and got 2 twins pushed together which was the only bad thing. The room was ok size, one English news channel on tv, expensive mini bar – but was as expected. The room and bathroom were very clean and in good condition, and maid did respect the do not disturb sign every day we were there. There was air conditioning and heating which you worked yourself so we could control it which was fine. Not too hot or cold. The bathroom décor and facilities were new enough. There is a lobby bar which is very small and the hotel has a café next door. We didn’t use either though. The breakfast was from 7 until 10.30 which is good for late risers like me. It was a very good buffet of hot and cold items, was very well supplied right up until the end and with good service for tea/coffee to the table. As regards location, it is well located or not so well located depending on your opinion. It is on a very busy road about 5 minutes walk from Port Vell. It is right beside a metro station which was great as we used the metro a lot. It is walking distance of a lot such as the port, Plaza Espanya, the Montjuic Park, Las Ramblas, Gothic Quarter, shopping areas and Plaza Catalunya so you do not always need to take metro and it is possible to walk at night out to restaurants and bars and back again so no need each time for taxis. It is about 10 mins walk to Las Ramblas down Nou de Rambla which is the side road opposite the hotel entrance. And we did walk a lot. However, what I did not realise when booking was that this hotel is on the edge of El Ravel which is the red light district and a not a great area in general. This area is in between the hotel and Las Ramblas. It did feel a bit intimidating on some of the streets in the area both day and night. However, we got used to it, and Nou de La Rambla was actually fine at night to walk through – it also has a police station on it so I guess that is why people say to use this street. We walked about at 2/3am in the morning with no problems. Some people may prefer though to stay in a nicer area at the other end of las ramblas nearer catalunya. Las Ramblas also towards the port area did get a bit intimidating at night. I was not impressed with Las Ramblas at all. I think I had a more romanticised view of what this street was about. The other streets around it are far nicer to walk down. And what is the story with everyone trying to sell cans of beer on the street??! Thankfully the rest of Barcelona was much nicer than Las Ramblas and I needed far longer than 5 days to enjoy it. However, where was all this great nightlife I thought it had? I guess you really need to know the places to go. I found the nightlife and selection of bars and restaurants disappointing and it did not live up to my expectations of a hopping all night scene in and out of bars and clubs. Then again, I’m used to that being normal at home. In summary, I would stay again in the hotel as it was very central and I had no complaints about the hotel itself, especially if it was cheaper at a less busy time of year. And Barcelona was great city with plenty to see and do so I hope to get back to visit those places I didn’t get to on this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Base”
Reviews.Author: Goonerne
Reviews.Content: We just come back from a wonderful stay in Barcelona and chose this hotel for what looked like a great hotel base to explore. The hotel its self was just perfect from the check in to check out. The staff were very friendly and helpful and any request i asked for was granted eg. extra pillows. The breakfast was just great the best we have had in a city hotel across europe. The rooms were very clean and tidy as was the hotel in general. If i have one little complaint i think the bar is a bit small for the hotels size and gets a bit noisey when full, but all in all i think this is a great hotel to explore Barcelona with the main streets just minutes away and right on top of the metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: The Single room I stayed in was nothing to write home about, although it was clean and quiet. Cleaners are very noisy and didn't respect the "do not disturb" sign. Tiny shower inside a square little bath-tub. The check-in/check-out was fine if a tad cold, let me stayed in a hour longer without problems. The best part of this hotel is the excellent location, just in front of the Metro Parallel (2 stops from Espanya and 10 minutes from Sants Station, 20 euro from the airport by taxi), and within walking distance from the Rambla. There are a lot of choices to eat locally.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Adz99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference with work and it has good and bad points. Good Points: The location is excellent with the port and La Ramblas in walking distance, The beds were comfy, The staff are very friendly and efficient Bad Points A group of 120 of us and they needed a scan of each persons passport - thus check in was a long and complicated affair The carpets and bathrooms in the rooms are in dire need of refurbishment. the bathroom especially was not good. Units and taps from the 1970's with all metal worn down from the years of cleaning. No fan either so some of the ceiling was rusting. Random screwdriver stuck in the ceiling... Breakfast average. Wouldnt choose to saty here again.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else there are better places for that price”
Reviews.Author: Germanz_on_tour
Reviews.Content: Well I wonder about myself that I did land here, maybe because of the nice photos on their page and the fact that it is close to all the relevant places you want to go in Barcelona. But the money you have to pay to get that goody is by far too much. The hotel has seen it`s best time during the Olympics in 1992 I suspect and since than there was not too much done on the interieur. The carpets are disgracefully dirty and I really have seen cleaner places before....The service at the reception can not be called as such, customers obviously have to apologize before they get served. I will not write comments about the quality of the breakfast and the food in their Bar/Restaurant otherwise this report will be deleted. Hhmm, to what I have seen else I am afraid this can happen in other places in Barcelona as well. Too much guest for the capacity of the towns hotels, might end up in a rip off (here it was definetely)

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: gcjambo
Reviews.Content: we booked this stay on the hotels own website sol melia and got a great rate! convenient hotel right next to parel-lel metro station. we had no problems with noise but i think we might have been at the back of the hotel. loved barcelona as a city and cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ian_&_Allison
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp Apolo for three nights from the 10th to the 13th June. There were 6 people in total in our group occupying three double rooms. The reason we chose the Apolo was because they were offering three nights for the price of two which worked out about £80 per night per room. This price didn’t include breakfast but when we checked in they gave us a card which we could use in the restaurant to get two breakfasts for the price of one. The cost of breakfast was 18 euro so we thought we would try it out on our first morning. I have to say none of us were disappointed and all of us agreed that it was one of the best breakfasts we have had in a hotel. My friend particularly enjoyed his smoked salmon with scrambled eggs. I liked the fact they made omelettes on request with fillings of your choice in front of you. Well worth the money. The rooms were very clean with mini bar but no tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was stocked with free soaps, shampoo, toothbrush, comb, razor and shoe polish kit. The location is excellent with only a 5 to 10 minute walk to The Rambla. The tube station is literally outside the main door and is very handy for getting around. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. Would stay there again if the price was right. Only down side of our trip was that my friend had his wallet stolen within 10 minutes of getting on the train at the airport on our way to the hotel. One of the ladies in our group nearly had her bag dipped at the same time. Obviously this is no reflection on the hotel but Barcelona itself.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona is the place.”
Reviews.Author: PerthPensioner
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute through a travel agent. She told us there was a continental breakfast included. The breakfast was much more. From fruit, juices, meats, cheeses, tortillas, sausages, tomatoes, scrambled eggs, muffins, biscuits, chocolate slice, expresso coffee,fresh fruit. I could go on and on. It was excellent. The room was more than adequate although there was only one english speaking channel, CNN. The bathroom was very clean but in need of refurbishment. The shower was excellent. Staff spoke English and were very pleasant. I would definitely go back. Only a 5 - 10 minute walk from the port end of La Rambla. It was easy to eat out and saunter back in the heat. All in all we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: danacaryindc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 5 fabulous days in Barcelona. The location of this hotel is perfect for exploring this beautiful city. The non-upgraded rooms are clean, but nothing special. However, we would rather not spend our weak US dollars on a the excellent food and wine in lieu of a room. I would highly recommend this hotel. We did not experience the noise that other people have......but, we also never made it back to the hotel before 1:00 am ( Barcelona hops all night).

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shroppiefly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights 18th April. Its a business class hotel. Its find for a bed & breakfast type of stay. The location is not too bad really,10 mins from las Rambles nice easy walk to Plaza Espana (30 mins) and 5 mins from Harbour / beach. Breakfasts are fine,a good choice(not too much)but more than adequate. Just a point if folk don't know.There is a water shortage in Barcelona which is likely to carry on for a while(until it rains for 40 days etc)they have turned off all fountains,showers on beach etc. The Magical Fountains to be found in Plaza Espana are only on from 7.00pm to 8.30pm.Its really pointless as you'll not be able to see the colours.Hear the music yes. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenialexis
Reviews.Content: I meant to write this review for a long time...the hotel is really great and I would feel guilty if I didnt mention anything The room are wonderful and spacious....extra clean with beautiful bathrooms. Although the location itself could be more central, if you dont mind walking a bit, you will be at La Rambla in 10 minutes or so But the best part is the impeccable service....thank you Miguel for making our stay perfect

Reviews.Title: “It was okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: yschoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Apolo Tryp for 2 nights and was pretty standard though the room was a fairly good size and the beds were comfortable but the bathroom seemed a bit dated and as some reviewers had noted, rust was building up - not a pretty sight. Also not impressed by their Lux shower/hand gel pumps in the shower and near the sink as it made the hotel seem a bit cheap and not a 3/4 star hotel. Also, we arrived in the morning and it turns out that we advised not to use any water as they were doing water treatment that day but we were not told this, we had to read this ourselves upon check-in. No big deal I guess, I could just be washing myself with highly chlorinated water ... The location was good though with it being a 10 minute walk to the La Ramblas and directly outside, there is a Metro stop which means everywhere is accessible. It was good value for money though but might not stay here again unless I get a good deal. No comment on the restaurants as I didn't eat there at all - there are far many better places to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huuhkaja
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of our two weeks Spain holiday. This is standard hotel with clean room and very good breakfast. We have didn´t have any disappointments when we stayed here. Also hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They f.ex knew right opening hours to sights and so on. We rate this hotel to be between three and four stars. Mainly 3+. Twin beds were ok and comfortable. Location: next to Paral-lel metro station. Hectic area (traffic), but easy access to Las Ramblas by 10min walk and 3-5min to harbour. Pros: + Clean, standard size room with wardrope and basic amenities. + Air conditioning was good, SAT-TV, Minibar, electronic safe. + No water problems with shower bath. + Our room was in good condition. + Soundproof in our room was ok. We didn´t hear any disturbing noises as our room was facing to the narrow side street near main street corner. + Full buffet breakfast was very good. Many choises of cold and hot dishes and there was f.ex fresh strawberries with desserts. + guard at the door and lobby. Cons: - Traffic at front of hotel (Avenida Paral-lel). Request room facing inner yard if you want to avoid street side rooms possible noise. You have then view to hill of Parc de Montjuic and also for two factory pipes. As this for notice.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel- highly recomended!”
Reviews.Author: omer2710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel at the beginning of January 2008 for a long weekend in Barcelona. The hotel is clean, the service is kind and helpful, the location is one of the best in the city - close to the port and right next to parallel metro station, where the funicular to montjuic is also situated. also in the vicinity of the hotel - Apolo theatre and Disco, plus number of inexpensive and quite good restaurants. The breakfast was good and satisfying, and cost only 10 euros per person. Rooms were always clean, and there was no noise from the street. All in all -I have nothing but good things to say about the hotel, and will surely come back to it the next time I'm in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Tryp Apolo: What am I paying for?”
Reviews.Author: ATrivialWord
Reviews.Content: In a hotel, especially one in a foreign city, one requires very few things: sleep, a shower, and occasionally some help from the front desk staff. At the Tryp Apolo, we received none of these. The hallway, admittedly, is clean and adequate, but the room was not. After a completely sleepless night due to noise and temperature issues, I rose earlier than expected to take a refreshing shower, only to discover that the shower changed temperature approximately every 15 seconds. The soap dispenser (not a bar, but a body/shampoo soap dispenser) was annoying to operate and made me feel dirtier when I was through. Each time we asked at the front desk for tourism help--including the opening hours and days of certain landmarks--we were given conflicting answers, none of which turned out to be correct. Breakfast was promising, with a good variety of foods. Additionally, the hotel's location makes touring easy, being a few minutes walk from Las Ramblas and virtually next door to a Metro station. However, when we returned to our hotel room, we discovered that our temperature, which we'd spent the first 24 hours adjusting, had been changed although the room was not adequately cleaned. Finally, after paying the exorbitant rate of 22 euros for 24 hours of internet, when it ceased working we went downstairs to ask about how to get it to work. The front desk staff was not only unhelpful, but following a lengthy discussion, which clearly proved they were not listening, we were told that it was an external service and therefore not their problem. The last time I was in Barcelona, I booked a 6 euro per night bed in a 16 bed hostel room, and I had a better experience there. I am very disappointed in the Tryp Apolo, and the location and breakfast do not make up for this appalling experience. Even without a refund, checking out early was the preferable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Tam Carr
Reviews.Content: Journey to the hotel from the airport took about 25 minutes and cost 25 Euros. The taxi meter only showed about 20 but there is an extra charge for each item of luggage or so we were told. The return journey 4 days later cost 30 Euro but we did go a different route. Check-in at the hotel was fine and we were given room 212 on the second floor (non smoking). Even though we had requested a double bed room 2 months previously we found that we were in a twin. I immediattely called reception and asked to be moved but was told the only double they could offer was in a smoking room. Of course I refused this and made my disappointment known to them however in typical a Spanish manner they appeared not to care. Further disappointment was noted when we saw the state of the tiles in our bathroom. One was actually broken and there was a hole in the wall and numerous others were cracked badly. A large rust stain was also marking the tiles below the steel bath rail. This should not happen in a so called 4 star hotel however after my experience complaining about the twin room we decided to accept out lot and put up with it. You can see the tiles and rust stain clearly in the photos we have added. On a positive note the rest of the hotel was in a good condition of maintenance and gave no impression that some of the rooms may not live up to the standard of the lobby and restaurant. Breakfast was of a very good standard with both hot and cold buffet items, fresh fruits and all the other usual early morning items we have grown to enjoy. The hotel is also very well located for tourists. The harbour area and thet end of Las Ramblas is less than a 10 minute walk away. We did enjoy our stay at the Apolo but would not return there or recommend it to friends due to the disappoinments we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Convenient (esp to cruise port)”
Reviews.Author: kaisatsu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a few nights before and after a roundtrip cruise from Barcelona. I got an alert through a travel deal newsletter that the parent company Sol Melia was having a huge sale on off-season rooms, and we were able to book our stay for less than it would have cost to stay at most 2-star Barcelona hotels. For such a low price, I wasn't expecting much, so I was very pleased with the value we got. The hotel is just out of the well-tread tourist area, but it's an easy 10-minute walk to La Ramblas. The walk isn't the most scenic - passing mostly kebab shops - but I didn't feel the area was particular seedy or dangerous. The hotel is also right at the Parallel metro station, which is convenient for longer trips and the Montjuic funicular. Having stayed farther north on a previous visit to Barcelona, I actually enjoyed being farther south with quicker access to the Gothic Quarter. The hotel was especially convenient for our cruise transfer, and the taxi to the ship was just a few minutes and a few Euros. The hotel itself is a fairly non-descript business-style hotel. The lobby is well appointed, although the hallways and rooms could use a bit of refurbishing. The rooms are on the small side but not tiny. Ours looked out over the inner courtyard for an uninspiring, but quiet view. The bathrooms were reasonably equipped with the generic hotel fixtures, including a weak wall-mounted hairdryer. However, during showers the water temperature fluctuated enough to be annoying. The television aired no English channels except a payment-required film channel. One fun feature is the pillow menu that allows you to phone the front desk and order one of a half dozen varieties of pillows according to your tastes. We used this service for both our stays, but on the second, they simply brought us additional versions of the standard pillow rather than the type we'd requested. Overall, my impression of the hotel was extremely generic. The location is decent if you don't mind a short walk, and for the price we paid, it was a fabulous deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Jeryl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Tryp Apollo Hotel in Barcelona! We arrived at 8:30am and were permitted to check in-really nice after 8 1/2 journey from the US! We booked two rooms for our family of five (two adults and three teens) and were quite pleased. We did in fact have five nice comfortable beds-NOT just a pull out couch or cot! The hotel rooms were spacious and clean. The bathrooms were nice and spacious too. We got new towels daily and rooms were always cleaned. The buffet breakfast was included and was delicious complete with: a variety of fruits, breads, croissants, meats, scrambled egges, fried eggs, fried vegies, salad, cheese, three fruit juices, an omelette station. Coffee is VERY strong and I like Starbucks so be warned. There were many English speaking employees to assist us. The Metro is right outside the front door and really is a must. The Metro system in this city is excellent, clean, safe and easy to use. We never took a taxi the entire trip except to the airport! My only complaint-just as the reviews in general on this site warned about Barcelona-it is a very noisy city! We were on the third floor and although the night was quiet on Wed-the night we arrived, it was very noisy Thurs-Sat! If you have a choice when you check in, make sure you do not face the building under construction. It is also where the car garage, night club and casino are located. I'm not kidding when I tell you that Sat. night there were large crowds lined up for a 3:00 am show-right below our window. Also, still noise at 6:00am!!

Reviews.Title: “Hungry traveler-still hungry”
Reviews.Author: rcbeeson
Reviews.Content: We had friendly and helpful service. The room was clean. The breakfast buffet we had on arrival was ok but way too expensive for what was served and the waitress was not very friendly or helpful (impatient). Finally, due to our early departure, our pre-arranged breakfasts were changed to "picnic boxes". That was acceptable to us except that when we opened them in the cab (on our way to the airport) we found the boxes filled with someone's leftover garbage. We called the hotel from the airport and asked to have our bill credited for the breakfast. We were told to call back to talk to a manager. We called back several hours later and talked to a manager who was aware of the problem but said she would have to check into it and call us back. I asked if our bill would be credited and the manager repeated she would have to check into it. It's been almost a week and we haven't heard from the management.

Reviews.Title: “Close by the action”
Reviews.Author: Isladeiona
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Found hotel to be very clean. Staff were pleasant. Rooms were average size but have no balcony. Most of the time we kept the window closed anyway due to the traffic noise as the hotel is situated on a main road, also there are street activities opposite hotel. For breakfast there was a buffet with ample choice. The one complaint here is there are no milk jugs, when you order tea and it arrives you then have to go back to the buffet bar to pour your milk. Very inconvienent, easier to pour some milk into a glass as you choose food. The hotel is in a very good location and within easy walking distance to La Ramblas and also the Port.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel not far from the part”
Reviews.Author: k9fun
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a group of 12. Stayed one night at Tryp. The hotel was very nice. Not far to the port which is at the end of Las Ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but Front Office Staff not trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: TerryLondon
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there from the 20-22nd Feb for 2 Nights. The Hotel was nice, but 1 member of staff 'ryan ford' was a conman. We were there to see the barcelona / liverpool football game. Tickets were on sale at the stadium for 73 euro. Ryan Ford Charged us EUR 200. He first told us that he could arrange tickets for us but at a EUR 30 premium - which was fine. He then informed us the next day (after giving him money) that it was impossible to get tickets but that he would keep trying. In the meantime we were able to buy tickets from the football club itself. Later that morning, he called us to say he had tickets, but the price was now EUR 200. So, what do we do.....? we had to pay him more money to get tickets we didn't want and then we had to sell the tickets to other people for EUR 200, even though tickets were available at the stadium. If you ask me, i think and feel that this was a very good scam. I would not recommend staying at this hotel as I do not trust Ryan Ford.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but street noise is a big problem”
Reviews.Author: schoolgirlsweekend
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for 2 nights (Wednesday and Thursday) and our rooms were located on the side of the hotel. The noise from young people talking, shouting, laughing, drinking etc. from approx. 3.30a.m. to 5.30/6.00a.m. on the pavement/street outside our window was unbearable and kept us awake. This problem must be addressed. If we had been staying for longer we would have insisted on moving rooms. The hotel otherwise is excellent. Breakfasts are delicious and the reception staff spoke very good english and were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Tryp!”
Reviews.Author: JourneyKat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tryp for 4 nights, and it was one of three hotels that we stayed in while we were in Barcelona. It was the hands-down winner for nicest place we stayed. We wish we could have stayed longer, but it was fully-booked for some of the nights of our visit, so we had to move. The rooms were quite nice and we heard no noise coming from the halls. There was a bit of street noise (we were on the 4th floor), but nothing that kept us awake. I was able to schedule wake up calls through the television, which was very convenient. Internet access was expensive, but reliable. Breakfasts were lovely, but were not included in the price of the room. This was okay, as they were reasonably priced. The rooms were very clean and attractive, and the staff was very helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: wisekatebushfan
Reviews.Content: ok...so the tryp apolo aint going to win any major prizes in anything but......... this hotel is in a good location for las ramblas and the beautiful port area. the tryp is spacious and clean, the room was clean with the usual facilities such as cable, mini bar hair dryer etc. it didn't have wifi or tea/coffee facilities in the rooms, which is poor for a 4* hotel in this day and age. breakfast was great with a wide choice of hot and cold food including the usuals such as eggs bacon, continental cold cuts, pastries,fruit and cerals etc....served buffet style you can get your full to set you up for the day. the location of the hotel is really not that bad, sure it looks a little ran down, but i certainly didn't feel unsafe walking in the area day or night and there is a police station on de la ramblas..........if you follow the usual, common sense, precautions when out and about you will be fine. on the whole the staff at the hotel were friendly with just the odd one being a 'bit off' but if the truth be told a lot of barcelonians can be fairy rude so the friendly ones ,and there are many, should be seen as a bonus! in short this is a decent hotel in a good position for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We flew in a day before our mediterranean cruise and stayed at the Tryp Apolo which was recommended to us by our travel agent. Had no complaints. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and true to the picture on expedia. Location was great, metro stop just a few steps from the hotel, within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and the waterfront, short cab ride to cruiseships.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: luxurytraveller21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late May 2006 for a works conference, so I had no choice over the location or price. Our group of 26 arrived and in front of us there were a group of 40 checking in so it took a while but we had pre allocated rooms so it wasn’t too bad. A gentleman on reception gave a wondrous recommendation for a nearby lunch restaurant which served tapas (and I don’t even like tapas) I wish I had kept the name. The rooms are really average for a 4 star hotel more like 3 star but no major complaints. Don’t expect much of a view; mine was of a building site. I know you don’t come away to watch TV but I do like to have English station on sometimes and the majority are French and German. Also a warning for parents is that there are some ‘hardcore’ channels just on regular TV, which was a bit shocking for this English prude. My first time in Barcelona, but I didn’t really get to see anything because of work. The hotel is within walking distance of most areas. A previous review said the bar prices were expensive, I didn’t get time to go to the bar but I can say walk out of the hotel towards the port and in under 5 minutes you have a supermarket where you can buy chilled drinks for next to nothing. Taxis seemed to be quite reasonable and plentiful around town.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: justlivingthedream
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks through May-June 2006. Some food for thought: - Very noisy if you are in a room that faces the street. Be prepared to wake up to ambulances and partying (on the weekends, partying is until 6am) - Hotel is a bit run down, but from what I understand, is still in better shape than many. The beds are like sleeping on box springs and very low to the ground. - The area surrounding the hotel is not the greatest by any means. Pickpockets, live sex shows, you name it....a guy was arrested on the steps of the hotel while we were there (pickpocket). - Breakfast consists of a wide selection of ham, salami, cold cuts, tomatos and pastries. - Customer service at the front desk is hit or miss. Some very arrogant, some very polite. Ryan and Miguel were nice, while Vanessa and the other female at the desk were downright rude about anything, no matter how uncomplicated the question.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was accommodating when it came to speaking English, they made every effort to speak it. The breakfast was good, a lot of choices and clean. However, the location is a bit mind boggling. We stayed on the third floor and about 4:00 in the morning, a club closed and all of the people from the club remained outside and was very load and it made it very hard for us to sleep. This continued on for about 2 hours, we were not the only ones complaining about this loud ruckus.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twingomine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tryp Apolo for 4 nights. The hotel in it self is quite ok, little run down but nice people and good service. The hotel is close to WTC but to close to La Rambla for my tast. The connecting roads to this area are in the late evenings and nights a dangerous place to be. If you like quietness, as I do, ask for a room at the backside not fasing the street and higher up. The hotel has maximum 6 floors. Do not expect a excellent view, but you cant get it all. And quietness is worth something I think:-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THERESA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights with a group of 45 Students. They were very nice to Us and the Rooms were very clean and well stocked with whatever is needed. The Breakfast served in the Morning was Fantastic. I really took advantage of the wide varitey of Foods that were served. I especially enjoyed the Salami's and Ham's they had available. The bake goods were outstanding and all very fresh and made right there at the Hotel. The only thing I could possibly complain about was the NOISE. My God it was awful. There is a Movie House next door and the line was very long and noisy. I couldn't believe the Loud mouths out there all night just talking, yelling, singing and just plain loud. I mean we had 45 People in our group 7 Adults and the rest Teenagers, and We didn't make any noise. In fact several kids complained about the noise. So You know it must be bad... But I would stay there again. All the action is right there, and it's not a bad area at all. I felt safe all the time. So didn't take the reviews regarding it being a bad area. They are full of it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: clio3
Reviews.Content: just back today from barcelona, and we stayed at the tryp. excellent,i would recommend this hotel to anyone. have read other reviews about the area and so forth, but i think they were over exagerated, the area is fine, with a straight road past the police station to the ramblas, and the hotel itself is first class. we stayed out most nights till at least 2am and we never felt threatened once. i would certainly stay here again. ellie

Reviews.Title: “nice, but you can find better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in december 2005 , five nights, including new year's eve. The hotel is very close to la ramblas , but the neighbourhood is not very safe, the underground train is next door and my advice is to use it, especially in the night. The staff was nice, but only one receptionist was speaking enlish, so, they couldnt help too much.anoter important thing - they never told us that on new year's eve, barcelona's taxi service is not working at all, so you have to book one few days before, otherways you take the train or...walk. You can find better hotels in barcelona and pay the same money. In my opinion, barcelona is The most beautiful city in europe, the city tour is very good, the food and drinks amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but........”
Reviews.Author: Gibfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite nice for the price we paid. The staff were very efficient and polite. Unfortunately, we were dissapointed with the breakfast, the variety was very poor compared to other hotels in the Sol/Melia/Tryp chain. The coffee served was terribly weak too. Location-wise, its pretty central but just off the main areas to provide some peaceful sleep at night. The english channels on the TV were all pay per view, and you price includes 4 movies, a bit too much unless you are planning to spend your holiday in the hotel room!
